subclassFeature.name: AI Futurist
entries: {@i Advance Your Artificial Intelligence}

As a Futurist, you believe that artificial intelligence is the zenith of all invention. To engineer a perfect AI, one which is capable of inventing on its own merits, is to conquer limitless problems by proxy. After all, an advanced AI which doesn't degrade into a rogue intelligence could turn its vastly superior intellect to dramatically improving the world, innovating in ways organic minds couldn't imagine. Your experiments with neural networks and intelligence theory have steadily edged you closer to finding such an AI, and granted your AI companion newfound aptitude along the way.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Subroutines
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, choose for your AI to run Adaptive Accuracy or Predictive Avoidance. You can command it to switch subroutines as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Adaptive Accuracy
entries: When you miss a target with an attack, your AI evaluates the mistake and corrects for it. The next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Predictive Avoidance
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, your AI predicts the next incoming strike. That attacker has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes against you this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Novel Intelligence
entries: Your AI's intellect has improved, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Skill
entries: You choose one additional skill from the list in your AI Companion to gain the benefits of that feature.

entries.name: Translator
entries: Your AI knows all languages.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Analysis
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, your AI examines one creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. You learn one of the following pieces of information: the target's {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}, its {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, its {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, its {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerabilities}, or any spells that currently affect the target.

subclassFeature.name: Reactive Hack
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack against you with a weapon that is {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24}, such as a {@item Laser Sword|DarkMatter24} or blaster, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command your AI to disable that technology. The attacker must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw against your Gadget save DC or the weapon is disabled until the end of the current turn. The attacker must use a different weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} or lose the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Hyperintelligence
entries: When you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Cyber Surgeon
entries: {@i Heal and Experiment on Your Allies}

Cyber Surgeons are at the cutting edge of medical science, using serums infused with nanomachines and experimental biochemistry to do the impossible. Their mandate is not to heal, however, but to learn‚Äîa fact that many of their patients discover only after becoming unwitting lab rats for a new drug.

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Surgeon
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|XPHB} skill, if you didn't already have it. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Bio-Serum
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can inject yourself or one creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself with an advanced healing serum. The target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Gadgeteer level. Additionally, the creature can expend one of its {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} and rolls that die. The creature regains additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Lazarus Bolt
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can drive a bolt into the torso of a creature within 5 feet of you that has died within the last minute and shock it back to life. That creature revives with 1 Hit Point and gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Gadgeteer level. This feature can't return to life a creature that lacks a heart, a creature that has died of old age, or a creature that is missing vital organs.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending two uses of your Bio-Serum (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Trials
entries: When you use your Bio-Serum, you can give the target the effect of one of the following spells of your choice (no concentration required) in addition to the serum's normal effects: {@spell Blur|XPHB}, {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB}, {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Spider Climb|XPHB}. The effects of the spell end early for that creature if you use this feature on that creature again.

subclassFeature.name: Biotech Field
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can activate a healing field in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. You restore up to 100 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, divided as you choose among any number of creatures within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. A creature that regains 1 or more {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from this feature has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Drone Jockey
entries: {@i Command a Swarm of Flying Drones}

Most Gadgeteers tinker with drones at some point in their career; after all, they're compact, useful projects, with a limited number of moving parts. However, only Drone Jockeys arm themselves with a fleet of programmed drones. By linking the drones' sensors and Construct cores, they create a cunning swarm intelligence, distributed over the network as a whole. This swarm can act almost autonomously, scouting the area and defending the jockey with mechanical efficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Drone Commander
entries: You have a special {@item Drone Controller|DarkMatter24}, which doesn't count against the number of magic items you can attune to. While using this controller, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Swift Command
entries: If you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, you can use your {@item Drone Controller|DarkMatter24} on your turn to command your drone without taking a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Intelligent Blaster
entries: You can use your Intelligence modifier for your drone's attack.

entries.name: Omni-Drone
entries: A drone connected to your {@item Drone Controller|DarkMatter24} counts as an Assault drone, a Medical drone, and a Shield drone.

entries.name: Drone Replacements
entries: If your drone is lost, you can create a replacement drone for no cost and connect it to the controller over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Swarm Tactics
entries: You have a second drone linked to your special {@item Drone Controller|DarkMatter24}. When you command your drone using the controller, you can command all of your drones connected to that controller at once, issuing the same commands or different ones.
When you reach Gadgeteer level 10, you gain a third drone linked to your controller.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Dive
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to interpose one of your drones between the attacker and yourself. The attack hits the drone instead of you.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Omega Upgrade
entries: You've upgraded the drones connected to your special {@item Drone Controller|DarkMatter24} in the following ways.

entries.name: Integrated Blaster
entries: Your drones deal {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage on hit.

entries.name: Revival Protocol
entries: The drone restores 18 ({@dice 4d8}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Shield Projector
entries: Roll a {@dice d8} and add it to AC instead of a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Hologrammer
entries: {@i Create Dazzling Holographic Distractions}

Armed with a sophisticated projector, Hologrammers create vivid, photorealistic holograms to confound their foes. Most often, they are accompanied by a holographic decoy, following their every movement as if one crossed their eyes.

subclassFeature.name: Hologram Projector
entries: You have an advanced projector used to create lifelike holograms. The energy used to power this projector is represented by a pool of Hologram points equal to your Gadgeteer level. You regain all expended Hologram points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

While holding the projector, you can cast one of the spells on the Hologram Projector table from it. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell and what Gadgeteer level you must be to cast it. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Decoy
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can create a holographic duplicate of yourself which follows your event movement and lasts for 10 minutes. When a creature hits you with an attack roll while your duplicate remains, roll a {@dice d6}. If it rolls a 3 or higher, the duplicate is hit instead of you and the duplicate is destroyed.

Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending 2 Hologram points (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Dazzling Devices
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Magic Item|DarkMatter24} ({@item Flashbang|DarkMatter24}) and {@optfeature Magic Item|DarkMatter24} ({@item Invisibomb|DarkMatter24}) Gadgets, which don't count against your number of Gadgets. When you take the {@variantrule Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Flashbang or Invisibomb.

subclassFeature.name: Holographic Burst
entries: When your Illusory Decoy is destroyed, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 2 Hologram Points to deal {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage to the attacker and immediately create a new decoy.

subclassFeature.name: Cognitohazard
entries: While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|XPHB}, {@spell Major Image|XPHB}, {@spell Mislead|XPHB}, or {@spell Silent Image|XPHB}, you can replace one of your attacks with the illusion lashing out against a creature you can see within 30 feet of the spell's image. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw against your Gadget save DC. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d6} plus half your Gadgeteer level (round down) Psychic damage and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Jumper
entries: {@i Leap Through Dimensional Portals}

Gadgeteers with an expertise in dimensional portals are known as Jumpers. Brandishing their signature portal devices, Jumpers can create and hop between portals in a blink of an eye. As their mastery over portal technology grows, they can enhance and manipulate their portals, teleporting themselves and others wherever they please.

subclassFeature.name: Slip Gate
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can activate a portal device to create two 5-foot diameter circular portals at locations you choose within 30 feet of yourself. The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings filled with mist that blocks sight. They float inches from the ground and are perpendicular to it. Anything that travels through the front of one portal is instantly transported to the other location, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the front of the portal. The portals dissipate after a creature travels through them, after 1 minute, or if you dismiss them on your turn (no action required).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Pit
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create a circular portal next to a Large or smaller creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your Gadget save DC or be pulled into the portal and be transported to a harmless demiplane for 1 minute. The portal then closes behind it. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat this saving throw, reappearing in the space if left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied on a success.

If the target succeeds its initial saving throw, the portal remains open until the end of your next turn. The portal floats inches from the ground and is perpendicular to it. A creature that is pushed into the portal is transported to the harmless demiplane as if it failed a saving throw.
Once you use this feature to create a portal, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Slip Gate
entries: When you or an ally goes through one of your Slip Gate portals, you can choose one of the following additional effects.

entries.name: Persistent Gate
entries: The portals don't dissipate after the creature travels through them.

entries.name: Shield Gate
entries: The creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Gadgeteer level plus your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Tele-Frag
entries: Immediately before the creature arrives at the destination, each creature within a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the destination portal makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Gadget save DC, taking {@damage 4d6} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Displacement
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with attempting to teleport an enemy you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your Gadget save DC or be teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice within 60 feet of yourself and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Mastermaker
entries: {@i Perfect Your Body Through Cybernetic Grafts}

Nearly all Gadgeteers strive for perfection in their work, but Mastermakers take this goal to a logical extreme: using the technology at their disposal, they seek to engineer away their own biological defects. By grafting Gadgets and technology onto their bodies (and making liberal use of vect components), Mastermakers gradually become hybrids of living beings and machines. They are stronger, tougher, and more agile than their counterparts, but many would argue that their techniques are too extreme‚Äîtoo unnatural‚Äîno matter what the results.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Construct Grafts
entries: You have improved your body with Construct grafts, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Grafts
entries: You gain two {@filter Common or Uncommon Construct grafts|items|source=darkmatter24|type=construct graft=sand|rarity=common;uncommon} of your choice. {@item Arm Cannon|DarkMatter24} and {@item Shield Module|DarkMatter24} are recommended.

entries.name: Quick Installation
entries: You can take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to install a Construct graft on your body.

entries.name: Painless Attachment
entries: You don't lose {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} from installing or removing grafts, and it takes you no time to recover after the attachment of a new graft.

subclassFeature.name: Reconfigure
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to your Strength, Dexterity, Charisma, or Wisdom score, to a maximum of 20. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change which ability score you choose for this bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Engineered Identity
entries: You gain special {@item Android Skin|DarkMatter24} and {@item Voice Changer|DarkMatter24} grafts, which don't take up External and Internal graft slots respectively. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the appearance of the Android Skin.

subclassFeature.name: Expendable Parts
entries: When you are hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to ensure that one of your installed grafts absorbs the brunt of the damage. The damage dealt to you is reduced by an amount equal to your Gadgeteer level plus your Intelligence modifier. The chosen graft is temporarily damaged. You can't use that graft or remove it from its body slot until you repair it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can't choose your special {@item Android Skin|DarkMatter24} or {@item Voice Changer|DarkMatter24} when using this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Construct Perfection
entries: By installing a Construct core into your head, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heightened Intelligence
entries: Your Intelligence increases by 2, to a maximum of 22.

entries.name: Immunities
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage and to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Quantum Mechanic
entries: {@i Manipulate Quantum Dynamics with Gadgets}

Gadgeteers at the forefront of physics often become Quantum Mechanics, creating devices to explore and exploit the paradoxical nature of tiny, fundamental particles. Through this arsenal of quantum tools, they can change the trajectory of blaster bolts, tunnel through solid matter, and manipulate probability in their favor.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Relativism
entries: You learn the {@spell Moment to Think|ValdaSpire24} cantrip. Additionally, whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Delay|ValdaPlayerPack} without a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Uncertainty Principle
entries: When you miss with an attack roll, you can reroll the attack and you must use the new roll. If this rerolled attack hits, the target takes damage as if you rolled a 1 on all of the damage dice.

subclassFeature.name: Quantum Tunneling
entries: You can activate a quantum tunneling device as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Until the end of your turn, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage and can move through occupied spaces as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If you end your turn in such a space, you are shunted to the last unoccupied space you were in.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Schr√∂dinger's Defense
entries: When you take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to activate a Feline Waveform Collapser. Roll a {@dice d20}. If the die rolls a 10 or higher, you take no damage.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If you roll a 9 or lower on the {@dice d20}, this use of the feature isn't expended.

subclassFeature.name: Entanglement
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can attempt to entangle yourself with a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your Gadget save DC or be linked to you for 1 minute. While linked, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage. Each time you take damage, the linked creature takes the same amount of damage. The Entanglement ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, if the linked creature dies, if the linked creature is ever more than 30 feet away from you, or if you dismiss it (no action required).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Coalition Arcanist
entries: {@i Conquer the Battlefield Through Tactical Superiority}

Warfare in the 'Verse is a perilous dance of arcana and technology that stretches across entire star systems. In this new theater of combat, none have adapted better than the Coalition and their squads of Warmage arcanists. Equipped with specially-designed blaster gauntlets, a coalition arcanist wields magic as others do a blaster: firing off spells automatically, in shotgun-style bursts, and in deadly beams that can level an entire company of foes.

subclassFeature.name: Blaster Gauntlet
entries: You gain a specialized {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} known as a Blaster Gauntlet. When you cast a Warmage cantrip that requires a ranged spell attack roll using this gauntlet as a focus, you can overheat the cantrip. The cantrip's damage dice increase by one step ({@dice d4} ‚Üí {@dice d6} ‚Üí {@dice d8} ‚Üí {@dice d10} ‚Üí {@dice d12}, to a maximum of d12s) for this casting. The cantrip then overheats; you can't cast this cantrip again until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Uplink
entries: You have been fitted with a neural implant, granting you unparalleled battlefield awareness. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to gain knowledge of the general lay of the land within a 1-mile {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. This knowledge only extends to surface-level or obvious features (natural or artificial) and doesn't detect creatures. Additionally, you have a +5 bonus to your Passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) score.

subclassFeature.name: Requisition
entries: You can requisition magic items from the Coalition's armory for short-term use. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose one of the following magic items, which is teleported to you: two {@item Attractor Mine|DarkMatter24|Attractor Mines} (which use your spell save DC), a {@item Dome Projector|DarkMatter24}, a {@item Gravity Nullifier|DarkMatter24}, a {@item Jetpack|DarkMatter24}, a {@item Ring of Spacewalking|DarkMatter24} (which is attuned to you automatically), or a {@item Universal Translator|DarkMatter24}. This item remains in your possession until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which time it is teleported back to the Coalition's armory.

subclassFeature.name: Squadsight
entries: Your tactical uplink synchronizes you with your allies, granting you a decisive tactical advantage. While you are within 120 feet of an ally, you know the exact location of any creature that your ally sees. Additionally, you can cast a Warmage cantrip targeting a creature that your ally can see. You launch the cantrip like a mortar, ricochet it off obstacles, or fire it through thin barriers to hit the target.

subclassFeature.name: Precision Hardlight Strike
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can mark a point you can see within 120 feet of yourself for destruction. At the start of your next turn, the Coalition delivers a magical bombardment in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 10d10} Force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried are reduced to ash.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Shepherd
entries: {@i Defend Machines with High-Tech Abilities}

When you heard the call, it was the electrical pips of binary Machine Code. The 'Verse is filled with Constructs of all shapes and sizes, from towering golems to simple automatons. Too often, however, machines are treated as disposable scrap. As a Steel Shepherd, you protect and repair neglected Constructs, speaking their buzzing mechanical language and raising hardlight barriers in their defense.

subclassFeature.name: Gearhead
entries: Your aptitude with machines grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24} skill. This is a new skill introduced in Dark Matter by Mage Hand Press. Additionally, you gain a bonus to checks using this skill equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

entries.name: Construct Empathy
entries: Whenever a Construct attacks you, it makes a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, its attack misses.

entries.name: Machine Code
entries: You know {@language Machine Code|DarkMatter24}, the native code-language of machines. Due to this language, you know the {@spell Technomancy|DarkMatter24} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this benefit (choose the ability when you select the feat).

subclassFeature.name: Hardlight Block
entries: You can project a shimmering barrier around an ally. The Block option of your Guardian Tactics affects an ally within 15 feet of yourself. At Warden level 14, it increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Blaster Veteran
entries: Your experience in firefights grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Mighty Blast
entries: When you make an attack with a Ranged weapon using Dexterity, you can gain a bonus to the attack and damage roll equal to your Strength modifier. The weapon then Overheats. An Overheated weapon can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Ranged Interrupt
entries: You can use Interrupt when an enemy you can see within 30 feet of yourself makes more than one attack on its turn.

subclassFeature.name: Golem Absorption
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage. Whenever an enemy subjects you to the chosen damage type, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to take no damage and instead regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of the chosen damage type taken.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending two uses of your Interrupt (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Juggernaut Protocol
entries: You can transform into a mechanized colossus. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain the benefits below for 1 minute or until you choose to end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size becomes Large, if it was smaller.

entries.name: Energetic Absorption
entries: You can use your Golem Protocol when an enemy subjects you to Force, Necrotic, or Radiant damage.

entries.name: Mighty
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Pneumatic Strength
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon, and the damage roll adds your Strength modifier to the roll, you can deal an extra die of weapon damage.

subclassFeature.name: Star Wolf
entries: {@i Lead a Squadron of Allies to Victory}

Whether they lead a company of Grax's Guys, a band of Coalition mercenaries, or a crew of space pirates, Captains who emblazon their ships with the Star Wolf's iconography seek fame and fortune amongst the stars. Their hallmarks are daring gunplay and swift starship maneuvers that always keep them a hair ahead of their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Dodge Roll [Maneuver]
entries: You can expend one Battle Die as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to move up to 15 feet and reload any Ranged weapon you are holding. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and is unaffected by {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Grazing Shot [Maneuver]
entries: When you miss with a ranged attack roll, you can expend one Battle Die (no action required) to deal damage to that creature equal to a roll of the die plus your Dexterity modifier (minimum). This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier. You can only deal this damage once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Squadron Leader
entries: When you are the Pilot of a ship you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to adopt a formation with up to 5 allied ships within 10,000 feet of yourself. Ships remain in this formation as long as they remain within 10,000 feet of you. Ships in a formation gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Barrel Roll
entries: Each ship in the formation has a +2 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

entries.name: Initiative
entries: Each ship has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

entries.name: Synchronized Movement
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Move and Fire|DarkMatter24} or {@action Evasive Manuevers|DarkMatter24} action, each ship in the formation can take the same action (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Target Designation
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mark a target you can see within 60 feet of yourself with a holographic reticle. The target remains marked for 1 minute or until you use this feature again. While marked, the target gains no benefit from {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} or {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover} and has a -2 penalty to AC.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend one Battle Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Snap Shot
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can make an attack with a Ranged weapon against a target you can see within 60 feet of yourself. On a hit, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attacks during the first round of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Focus Fire
entries: When you use your Blitz feature to command an ally to make an attack with a weapon, the ally deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage to a creature marked by your Target Designation. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Ionizer
entries: {@i Manipulate Energy to Defeat Your Foes}

Ionizers specialize in the transfer of energy. In the most benign applications, they design heatsinks and cooling systems to improve cutting edge technology. However, they also deal in destructive ends, designing lasers, energy shields, and especially blasters. With a few thermodynamic tricks, they command plasma in all its forms.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24} skill. This is a new skill introduced in Dark Matter by Mage Hand Press.

subclassFeature.name: Plasma Bomb [Formula]
entries: By replacing your {@item Bomb|ValdaAlchemist|Bomb's} explosive contents with an ion-fluxer, you can change it into a Plasma Bomb which adheres to a target it directly hits. This Bomb deals Radiant damage instead of Fire damage. If you use the Bomb's Explosive property, all of its damage dice are d6s; otherwise, all of its damage dice are d12s.

subclassFeature.name: Heatsink
entries: You've learned an alchemical trick to channel heat from one object to another. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 1 Reagent to use Overheat and Supercool.

entries.name: Overheat
entries: You direct heat toward an enemy or a weapon you can see within 30 feet of you. If you choose a creature, it takes {@damage 2d6} Fire damage. If you choose a weapon, the weapon overheats. An Overheated weapon can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Supercool
entries: You direct heat away from a weapon you can see within 30 feet of you, supercooling it. This weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} Cold damage on the next attack it makes before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Electromagnetic Shield
entries: When you are hit by a ranged attack that deals Force, Lightning, Necrotic, or Radiant damage, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 6, the attack misses you, regardless of its roll.

subclassFeature.name: Energetic Discharge
entries: You create a fist-sized device that can absorb, store, and redirect small amounts of energy. When you use your Electromagnetic Shield feature, regardless of your roll, your discharge device gains 1 charge, to a maximum of 10. Charges last for 24 hours. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend any number of stored charges to force a target within 60 feet of you to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Alchemist save DC. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} Force damage for each charge expended on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Technomancy
entries: With a complex input gesture, you can manipulate a technological device you can see within range. You can use this ability to perform any basic operation on the device, including, but not limited to: pressing an external button, entering a dozen keystrokes of data, performing an authorized operation (such as opening an unlocked door), dimming or brightening a screen, or muting a device that makes noise. You can't disconnect or reconnect wires, or perform an unauthorized operation without making a Hacking attempt.

skill.name: Piloting
entries: {@homebrew TBD. Please fix ability used once it is announced.}

skill.name: Data
entries: {@homebrew TBD}

skill.name: Technology
entries: {@homebrew TBD }

variantrule.name: Magical Technology
entries: Other gear, such as the {@item Comm Set|DarkMatter24|Comms Set} and {@item Wristwatch|DarkMatter24} are Magical Technology—devices powered by arcane batteries or other sources of magical energy. These devices don't rise to the complexity of magic items, but are still influenced by spells such as {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} and fail in Dead Magic Zones (see the Glossary).

{@i Choose A or B:} : (A) {@item Tactical Nanofiber Vest|DarkMatter24} ({@item Studded Leather|XPHB}), 2 {@item Antimatter Dagger|DarkMatter24|Antimatter Daggers}, {@item Antimatter Pistol|DarkMatter24}, {@item Concussion Rifle|DarkMatter24}, {@item Engineer's Pack|DarkMatter24}, and 7 CR; or (B) 1,000 CR

classFeature.name: AI Companion
entries: You are assisted by an AI Companion, an intricate data construct which lives on your {@item Datapad|DarkMatter24} and possesses human-like levels of intelligence. It manifests physically as a geometric projection near you; otherwise, it is merely a voice in your ear, checking your reasoning and informing you of relevant information.

Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter24}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Religion|XPHB}, or {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24}. {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24} is recommended. Whenever you make an Intelligence check with the chosen skill, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

Whenever you gain a Gadgeteer level, you can replace the skill you chose with a different one from the list. You can choose additional skills with this feature as you gain certain Gadgeteer levels, as shown on the AI Skills column of the Gadgeteer Features table.

classFeature.name: Alpha Prototype
entries: You make a breakthrough innovation with a prototype of your own design. You gain one Alpha Prototype of your choice from the "{@filter Alpha Prototype Options|optionalfeatures|source=|feature type=ap}" section later in the class description. Your prototype is considered {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24}.
Whenever you gain a Gadgeteer level, you can replace the prototype you chose with a different one.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Laser Sword|DarkMatter24|Laser Swords} and {@item Repeater|DarkMatter24|Repeaters}. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose.

classFeature.name: Gadgets
entries: You have built or amassed a collection of cutting-edge devices. You gain three Gadgets of your choice from the "{@filter Gadget Options|optionalfeatures|source=|feature type=g}" section later in the class description. All Gadgets are considered {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24}.

entries.name: Gaining Gadgets
entries: Whenever you gain a Gadgeteer level, you can replace one of your Gadgets with another one for which you qualify. When you gain certain Gadgeteer levels, you gain more Gadgets of your choice, as shown in the Gadgets column of the Gadgeteer Features table. You can't pick the same Gadget more than once unless its description says otherwise.

entries.name: Proprietary Design
entries: Your Gadgets are powered by a personal power cell. No other creature can use them.

entries.name: Replacing Lost Gadgets
entries: If one of your Gadgets is consumed or lost, you can replace it with a new one when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If a Gadget requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

classFeature.name: Overcharge
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature using a weapon or Gadget, you can deal an extra 2 Lightning damage to the target. As you gain levels as a Gadgeteer, this extra damage increases, as shown in the Overcharge column on the Gadgeteer Features table.

classFeature.name: Gadgeteer Subclass
entries: You gain a Gadgeteer subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Gadgeteer levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Gadgeteer level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Gadgeteer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Gadgeteer Subclass.

classFeature.name: Buffer Protocol
entries: When a Construct that you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to activate your Buffer Protocol. The Construct has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks, including against the triggering attack, until the end of the current turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Gadgeteer Subclass.

classFeature.name: Mastery Mods
entries: You can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to tinker with a weapon whose mastery property you can, improving its damage. When you use it, the weapon deals an additional die of damage on a hit. If its damage dice are d10s or d12s, it deals an additional {@dice 1d8} instead. This weapon retains this benefit as long as you can use its mastery property.
At Gadgeteer level 17, this extra damage increases to two dice, or {@dice 2d8} for weapons with {@dice d10} or {@damage d12} damage dice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Gadgeteer Subclass.

classFeature.name: Bluescreen Protocol
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with activating your Bluescreen Protocol. Choose a Construct that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Gadget save DC or have the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition for 1 minute, even if it would normally have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to that condition. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the condition on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Mastery Mods
entries: Your Mastery Mods extra damage increases to two dice, or {@dice 2d8} for weapons with {@dice d10} or {@damage d12} damage dice.

classFeature.name: Troubleshooter
entries: If you fail a saving throw against a spell, magic item, or {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24} and you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, you can cause yourself to succeed instead.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Gadget Matrix
entries: You can reconfigure your Gadgets on the fly. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your Gadgets with another one for which you qualify.

entries.name: Gadgeteer
entries: Gadgeteers are masters of technology and engineering, turning every device available to their advantage. Assisted by their AI Companions, Gadgeteers pursue the cutting edge of science and innovation, acquiring a mass of Gadgets and a wealth of knowledge along the way.

entries.name: Cutting-Edge Innovators
entries: Fueled by breakthroughs and scientific advances, Gadgeteers push the cutting edge of science and innovation, devising new technological marvels (or at least new blaster variants) at a breakneck pace. Some Gadgeteers become absorbed in a particular problem, innovating and optimizing solutions for it alone, while others devise technological marvels wherever they can find application. All the great advances of the modern world, from Datapads to Dark Matter engines, have been spearheaded by Gadgeteers.

entries.name: AIs
entries: A Gadgeteer is rarely seen far from their AI Companion, which is often represented by a glowing holographic abstraction. After all, an AI can recall equations, trace schematics, and perform calculations with ease. Such intellect is nothing without a Gadgeteer's ingenuity, of course, but the watchful eye of an AI can still spot errors that their creator might not have noticed.

But more than that, an AI companion is also a tireless friend. The endless work of a Gadgeteer can often be monotonous and isolating, but the constant, friendly voice of an AI in one's ear goes a long way to preventing mad scientists and doomsday devices.

optionalfeature.name: Experimental Frame
entries: You have developed a sophisticated Experimental Frame, a powerful exo-suit that augments your strength and shelters you from harm. Your frame counts as Heavy armor, which you can don or doff as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. You have training with this armor, but no other creature can wear it. While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size becomes Medium, if it is smaller.

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: Your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Intelligence modifiers. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Gadgeteer level at the start of each of your turns. These {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} vanish if any remain when you doff the armor.

entries.name: Life Suit
entries: The frame confers the benefits of a {@item Life Suit|DarkMatter24}.

entries.name: Integrated Weapons
entries: You can integrate a Melee weapon directly into your frame, or you can integrate two Melee weapons (one into each arm) if neither has {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. You can switch which weapons are integrated when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Whenever you attack with an integrated weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity.

optionalfeature.name: M.A.C.
entries: You have a M.A.C. (a Mechanized Autonomous Construct), which is a custom-designed Construct driven by your AI companion. It uses the {@creature M.A.C.|DarkMatter24} stat block. You determine its appearance, such as a cubical, treaded machine or an inflatable, bipedal robot.

entries.name: M.A.C. in Combat
entries: In combat, M.A.C. acts during your turn. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to command it to take an action in its stat block or some other action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, M.A.C. acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Repairing M.A.C.
entries: You can take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to temporarily repair M.A.C. while it has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. This repair allows it to move, but it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until it regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
M.A.C. gains the benefits of taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as normal. If M.A.C. is lost, you can build a new one for 250 CR.

entries.name: Customizing M.A.C.
entries: M.A.C. has two integrated weapons in its arms. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace either integrated weapon with a new weapon that doesn't have {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}. M.A.C. uses your Intelligence for attack and damage rolls with integrated weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Utility Matrix
entries: You have engineered a Utility Matrix, a device that can rapidly shift in form and function. You decide on its appearance, such as a belt of useful tools or a high-tech rearranging cube.
You can use the following options as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Once you use one of these options, you can't use that option again until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Blink Button
entries: You teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries.name: Cloaking Device
entries: You have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of the current turn. The condition ends early immediately after you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

entries.name: Forcefield Projector
entries: Until the start of your next turn, you have a bonus to your AC equal to your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Grappling Hook
entries: Choose a point you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You pull yourself to that point in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Auto-Hacker
entries: Whenever you make an ability check to open a lock, hack a locked piece of {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24}, or disarm a trap, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

optionalfeature.name: EMP
entries: You can cast {@spell Electromagical Pulse|DarkMatter24} without a spell slot or Material components. When you cast it in this way, {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24} worn or carried by you isn't affected.
Once you use this Gadget, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Flux Cannon
entries: This Gadget, which looks like a blaster ending in a series of lenses, modulates the temperature of matter. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with activating this device, targeting a Large or smaller creature or object or a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} area you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Choose Freeze or Heat.

entries.name: Freeze
entries: A creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Additional effects depend on the material. For example, most liquids instantly freeze and metals become brittle and shrink slightly.

entries.name: Heat
entries: A creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Additional effects depend on the material. For example, most liquids instantly boil and metals glow red-hot and become malleable.

entries.name: Gadget Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach Gadgeteer levels 11 ({@dice 3d8}) and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

optionalfeature.name: Magic Item
entries: You gain a magic item of your choice from the Magic Item Gadgets table for which you are the appropriate Gadgeteer level or higher. If this magic item requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, it doesn't count against the number of items you can attune to. If a magic item requires a saving throw, it uses your Gadget save DC.

Some options on the table grant you one or more consumable magic items—items which are used up once they are activated—the number of which is listed in parentheses. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you regain all of your consumed magic items.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this Gadget more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different magic item.

optionalfeature.name: Magnet Boots
entries: While you wear these boots, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. Additionally, in a Zero-Gravity environment, you can attract yourself to any surface within 100 feet of yourself as if it had normal gravity.

optionalfeature.name: Micro-Missiles
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with a barrage of micro-missiles. Each creature you choose in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Gadget Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach Gadgeteer levels 11 ({@dice 3d4}) and 17 ({@dice 4d4}).

optionalfeature.name: Omni-Grenade
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing this explosive device up to 30 feet, which detonates in a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Dexterity saving throw. Choose Fire, Ice, or Lightning. Once you use this Gadget, you can create a replacement for it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} Fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If you roll an 8 on the {@dice d8} for this damage roll, you can roll another {@dice d8} and add it to the damage, rolling again if it is an 8, and so on. You can add a maximum number of dice to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Ice
entries: Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} Cold damage and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Lightning
entries: Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} Lightning damage and it can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Gadget Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach Gadgeteer levels 11 ({@dice 5d8}) and 17 ({@dice 6d8}).

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Ray
entries: This Gadget produces a blast of psionic energy. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with targeting a creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself with the device. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Gadget Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach Gadgeteer levels 11 ({@dice 3d6}) and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Fists
entries: You have rocket-powered robotic gauntlets that follow your every gesture. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with launching the gauntlets, choosing Remote Control or Rocket Punch. The gauntlets return to you at the end of your turn.

entries.name: Remote Control
entries: You can use the gauntlets to fly up to 30 feet from yourself and manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. The gauntlets can't attack without using the Rocket Punch option, activate magic items or Gadgets, or carry more than 25 pounds each.

entries.name: Rocket Punch
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Gadget Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach Gadgeteer levels 11 ({@dice 3d6}) and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Sentry Turret
entries: As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, you can deploy this collapsible device in an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of yourself, where it unfolds into a Small, stationary blaster turret. You can recover the turret as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

The turret has AC 15 and {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times your Gadgeteer level, and it has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. Reducing the turret to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} destroys it.

When an enemy moves within 60 feet of the turret, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to command the turret to fire. Make a ranged attack roll using your Intelligence. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spectrum Visor
entries: This visor has a single long slit, blipping with lights and sensors. Choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to choose a different one.

entries.name: Aurasight
entries: You sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic. The sense is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 60 feet.

entries.name: Thermalsight
entries: You gain Thermalsight with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Thermalsight, its range increases by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Stasis Generator
entries: If you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, this Gadget activates, enclosing you in a shimmering, invulnerable sphere until the start of your next turn. Creatures, objects, and spells can't pass through the sphere. The sphere is weightless and can be picked up and moved by other creatures. While the sphere is active, you can't take damage or fail Death Saving Throws.
At the start of your next turn, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} equal to your Gadgeteer level and the sphere dissipates.
Once this Gadget activates, it can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Version 1812 Multirocket Launcher
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can activate this device, which unfolds into an elaborate multi-barrel rocket launcher and fires wildly in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you while playing a grand overture. Each creature you choose within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 12d6} Fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you activate this Gadget, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Gadgeteer level (M.A.C. has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Gadgeteer level)

trait.name: Defensive Protocol
entries: While you are within 5 feet of M.A.C., attacks against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Heavy Duty
entries: M.A.C. counts as one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

action.name: Integrated Mace
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals your Intelligence modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Integrated Phaser
entries: {@atkr r} Bonus equals your Intelligence modifier plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}{@damage 2d4} Lightning damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The drone doesn't provoke an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Integrated Blaster (Assault Only)
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Revival Protocol (Medical Only, 1/Day)
entries: The drone restores 9 ({@dice 2d8}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Shield Projector (Shield Only)
entries: The drone projects a shield around a creature within 5 feet of it. The next time that the creature is hit by an attack roll before the start of the drone's next turn, roll a {@dice d6} and add it to the creature's AC, potentially causing the attack to miss.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-5 feet tall) or Small (about 3-4 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Biomimicry
entries: You can also use your action to touch a creature and assume its general form. Your size and other statistics don't change. If the target has a Burrow speed, Climb speed, or Swim speed, you gain that speed, up to a maximum of 40 feet.

Your transformation lasts for 1 hour or until you dismiss it (no action required). If you transform into a form incapable of wearing clothing or armor, your clothing or armor falls off. Your ability to handle objects is determined by the form's limbs rather than your own.

entries.name: Flexible Form
entries: You can use your action to stretch, compress, and mold your body into a myriad of shapes. You can shape-shift into any static form that you choose that is no larger than 8 feet in any dimension. When you assume this form, you can replicate something's basic shape but not its color, texture, moving parts, or fine details. You can't change your body's volume, nor can you move, attack, or cast spells while you're shape-shifted into a static shape.

entries.name: Reform
entries: Whenever you take Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage from an attack and don't drop to 0 hit points, you take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately regain {@dice 1d4} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, up to a maximum of the amount of damage taken.
This healing increases to {@dice 1d6} at 5th level, {@dice 1d8} at 11th level, and {@dice 1d10} at 17th level.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Avian Eyes
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Insight|XPHB} or {@skill Perception|XPHB} skill. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Blessings of the Sun
entries: You know the {@spell Light|XPHB} cantrip. When you reach character level 3, you learn the {@spell Bless|XPHB} spell, and when you reach character level 5, you learn the {@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB} spell. You always have these spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast the spell in that way again when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast either spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Zealous
entries: When you fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 7-8 feet tall)

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe underwater. However, without your Aqua Suit, breathing air is uncomfortable for you, feeling similar to a human in very thin air.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any saving throw you make to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Aqua Suit
entries: Except when you are aboard a whorl ship, you wear a bulky Aqua Suit, which is filled with Poseidon Solution, in order to breathe comfortably. The suit covers your whole body, including a large domed helmet that allows you to see without hindrance.

You can don or doff the helmet on your turn (no action required), and you can don or doff the entire suit in 1 minute. If damaged but not completely destroyed, the suit rapidly mends itself, leaking a minimum amount of water. While wearing the suit, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armored Suit
entries: Your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can fit armor around your Aqua Suit and wear both simultaneously, using either armor to determine your AC. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage.

entries.name: Life Suit
entries: You gain the benefits of wearing a {@item Life Suit|DarkMatter24}.

entries.name: Universal Translator
entries: You can use the suit's embedded {@item Universal Translator|DarkMatter24} magic item at will.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 6-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Follow Through
entries: When you roll damage for a melee attack you make using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can reroll the damage dice and deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage to the target. You must use the new roll.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Gearhead
entries: Building sick rides is practically an orc pastime. You have proficiency with {@item Ship Maintenance Tools|DarkMatter24} and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any check you make to repair or modify a ship. Additionally, you have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Piloting|DarkMatter24}, or {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any saving throw you make to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 6-8 feet tall)

entries.name: Adaptive Metabolism
entries: Your body can quickly adapt to a range of extreme environments. You take no damage from the extreme temperatures of space and other harsh environments (see [Appendix E]), and you can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes.

entries.name: Gliding Wings
entries: You have a pair of membranous wings that you can use to glide clumsily through the air. While falling, you can move up to 10 feet horizontally for every 5 feet you fall, up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to damage you take as a result of falling.

entries.name: Hooked Claws
entries: Your digits end in short claws that you can use to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal Slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier instead of the strike's normal damage.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have an armored carapace. While you aren't wearing armor, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Regenerative
entries: If any part of your body is amputated, but its amputation doesn't kill you, that body part fully regrows over the course of 24 hours.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Construct Anatomy
entries: You don't need food, drink, or air. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

entries.name: Inflexible Mind
entries: Your mechanical mind is inherently logical and not easily swayed. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Reconfigurable Ability Scores
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can swap two of your ability scores. This change lasts until you use this feature again.

entries.name: Thermalsight
entries: You gain {@sense Thermalsight|DarkMatter24} with a range of 30 feet. (See the Glossary.)

entries.name: Construct Grafts
entries: You can take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to install a construct graft on your body. Additionally, you don't suffer any ill effects from attaching a graft in a body slot for the first time, and it takes you no time to recover after the attachment of a new graft. See [Chapter X] for construct grafts.
You have the following graft installed in the External slot:

entries.name: Embedded Armor
entries: Your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can wear armor on top of your Embedded Armor, and you can use either armor to determine your AC. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-7 feet tall)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Psionic Blast
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a burst of psionic energy against a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. This damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach character levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).
You can use this blast a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Psychic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Razor Claws
entries: You can use your teeth and claws to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal Slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier instead of the strike's normal damage.

entries.name: Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-7 feet tall) or Small (about 2-4 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Resourceful
entries: You gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Skillful
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Near-Human Feat
entries: You gain a {@filter Near-Human Origin feat|feats|source=darkmatter24|other=race} of your choice.

raceFluff.name: Amoeboid

entries: Another failed experiment, muttered Yr. The amoeboid's nucleus flashed dark red with resigned frustration as a pair of automatons scraped viscera off the walls and ceiling of his medical bay.

The serum made no difference—those cows were just like the last batch, grumbled Yr. He made his way to the next room, where a terrified human lay restrained on a table, yelling incoherently. Yr tapped the man on the shoulder with a blobby appendage, setting off a ripple of changes through the amoeboid's body, settling into the vague shape of a human with an overlarge head and bulging eyes.

Sorry for the inconvenience, Yr apologized in the man's language. "I wish I could repay you for your livestock, but we have rules against that sort of thing. Now please stop squirming while I prepare a memory modification.
entries.by: Yr, amoeboid scientist, assessing a Void experiment

entries: Amoeboids are intelligent, vaguely humanoid-shaped oozes that can mimic the form of any creature they touch. These beings dwell on maw stations, experimenting at the cutting edge of science and parlaying with any creature they encounter.

entries.name: Fluid Anatomy
entries: Amoeboid bodies are composed of a translucent jelly-like substance with a complex network of nerves visible throughout, emitting a dim light. They range in color from blues and purples to bubblegum pink, with scintillating rainbows in between. Within an amoeboid's head floats a large, brain-like nucleus surrounded by five radially-spaced eyespots—their unearthly equivalent of a face.

An amoeboid can take a genetic imprint of a creature they touch, molding into an inexact copy, visibly made of the same jelly material. When in this form, they can speak the language of their subject and move in much the same way, allowing them to empathize with virtually any creature.

entries.name: Mawkeepers
entries: Amoeboids originate on the maw stations and most reside there, researching the stations' ancient technology, repairing ships and Dark Matter engines, and meeting people from across the 'Verse. By default, their position is that of galactic ambassadors, a role in which many amoeboids relish. They tend to regard newcomers with curiosity and enthusiasm, a disposition that has transformed their maw stations into central meeting places across the 'Verse.

entries.name: Scientists and Visitors
entries: Most amoeboids view the 'Verse through a lens of science and reason. With proper experimentation, the multiverse can be defined solely through the workings of magic and physics. Amoeboid researchers regard no subject as taboo as long as its methodology is sound and likely to produce useful data.

For centuries, amoeboids have taken to secretly visiting undeveloped worlds, disguising themselves and their saucers to experiment upon the inhabitants. These experiments are usually noninvasive but nonetheless unwelcome. As a result, many worlds share tales of strange visitors from the stars, looking much like them, but strangely distorted, stealing away individuals by night and performing strange rituals in brightly lit rooms. Amoeboids will also vivisect the odd head of livestock, but these occurrences are more likely to be blamed on predators than on visitors from the stars.

entries.name: Amoeboid Names
entries: Ever concerned with efficiency, amoeboid names can traditionally be represented by a single unusual character, to differentiate it from the rest of a particular alphabet. Amoeboids don't differentiate between males and females, nor are their names particularly masculine or feminine.

entries.name: Amoeboid Names
entries: Ash (√Ü), Chevron (Œõ), Digamma (Õ∂), Eth (√ê), Ezh (∆∑), Gangia (œ™), Kai (œó), Pilcrow (¬∂), Psi (Œ®), Shei (œ¢), Solidus (/), Thorn (√û), Tilde (~), Yr (·õ¶)

raceFluff.name: Avia-Ra

entries: The center of the High Solarium bore a dazzling arrangement of polished bronze and glass lenses, flickering from one streak of light at the tip of the pyramid. As we lingered, captivated by the chamber's glow, our guide, the raven-headed Remembrancer Mose, stepped into the solarium's centermost platform. At once, the rays that cascaded throughout the solarium met their terminus, alighting her from every angle in a blinding radiance. A trick of the light, to be sure, but one that could have fooled us into believing everything she claimed: that the Sun Above itself spoke to her and delivered a prophecy.
entries.by: Jethro Meddlit, visiting the High Solarium of the avia-ra

entries: The avia-ra are a sun-worshiping race of wingless bird-people who travel to Low Worlds to spread their ancient religion.

entries.name: Ancient God-Kings
entries: Depictions of the avia-ra can be found in the ruins of ancient cultures throughout the galaxy. Often, but not always, they are portrayed as divinity manifest: godlike travelers from the heavens. Avia-Ra travel to more undeveloped worlds as evangelists of their solar religion—the Sun Above—and remain long enough to build an enduring civilization in their wake.

Some species consider the avia-ra an ancient and wise people, committed to the tenets of their religion. Others cast them as charlatans and false prophets, who routinely prey upon low worlds and defenseless peoples. The truth depends largely on perspective, but the avia-ra themselves aren't a monolith. Many have forsaken their faith or live agnostically, and the rest pledge varying devotion to the Sun Above.

entries.name: Watchers of the Citadel
entries: The heart of the avia-ra's religion is the Solar Citadel, which revolves close around the Sepulcher Star at the center of the galaxy. Most avia-ra make pilgrimage to this site at least once in their lives to bask in their holy sun, which (in their philosophy) gives light and meaning to all other stars. This worship is always directed at the Sepulcher Star itself, even if they are nearer to another star or no star at all. All other stars merely act as a metaphor, a symbol, of their holy sun.

In contrast to their binary doctrines, their actual relationship to the star and the Sepulcher within it is more complicated. The Solar Citadel definitively ensures that the star remains under avia-ra control, but the being within the star—Old Un—has never spoken to the avia-ra directly. Despite the silence, the avia-ra continue to pray in reverence and make pilgrimage to the Sepulcher Star.

entries.name: Deep Symbolism
entries: Avia-Ra are inclined to view the events around them as omens of larger struggles between light and dark, good and evil, and law and chaos. All things have symbolic importance and a place in the grand allegory, even fundamentally objective things like science and mathematics.

Most avia-ra hold dreams in especially high regard, for interpreted dreams can tell the future, lend insight into the past, or provide guidance for the present. Those with the gift to interpret dreams are honored as priests in the avia-ra and given elaborate titles, such as Grand Remembrancer or Dream-Teller Most High.

entries.name: Avia-Ra Names
entries: Avia-Ra names come in two-part cartouches, with one or both parts of the name being composed of the names of ancient avia-ra heroes and great ideals.

entries.name: Front Cartouche
entries: Anubis, Apophis, Cani, Canopis, Helio, Horus, Ira, Isis, Nefer, Oculus, Terra, Verum Rear Cartouche. Amet, Bast, Haten, Hotep, Intef, Lux, Ma'at, Mose, Omet, Osiris, Ptah, Set, Thoth
