entries: Attuning to these wings and an Ankh of Ra and a Heretical Sunstaff of Ra counts as being attuned to a single item. If you are attuned to the wings and one of these items, you can use the wings to cast the spell {@spell Daylight|XPHB} at will without using a spell slot.

item.name: Sorting Beast
entries: The Sorting Beast is a six-legged machine with eyes, legs, and antennae at both ends, as well as an array of measuring devices near its center. It can manipulate and hold objects up to 30 pounds in weight. When activated as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, the Sorting Beast sets about collecting and sorting all loose valuable items within 100 feet. It sorts all Gold Pieces, Silver Pieces, and Copper Pieces into neat stacks of 10. For material goods, such as precious stones, the machine can appraise value by weight and quality before sorting the goods appropriately and printing the results on a fine paper strip. The machine continues sorting until finished or deactivated (no action required). Additionally, the Sorting Beast can cast the spell {@spell Identify|XPHB}, without using material components, on an object you designate. Once it casts {@spell Identify|XPHB}, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Spider Pod
entries: When you throw this oblong metal container as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, it unfolds into a Mechanical Spider (see Monsters chapter for statistics). Your spider acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice). If the spider drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it can't be repaired. You can collapse the spider back down into its pod as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. You can only have 3 spiders under your control at any time.

item.name: Terraforming Engine
entries: This extraordinary machine, standing 40 feet tall and bearing great smokestacks, can transmute materials and balance a planet's atmosphere to support life. The engine can be activated or deactivated with 1 hour of work. If set down on a Tier 4 or higher planet, activated, and allowed to process the planet's water, atmosphere, and soil for a year, the engine lowers the planet's Tier by 1. The engine has no effect on a Tier 1 or Tier X world, and two terraforming engines can't lower a planet's Tier by more than 1 (though multiple engines might provide redundancy, should one fail). If the engine is deactivated or removed from the planet, the planet degrades to its original condition over the course of 7 days.

item.name: Universal Translator
entries: This handheld device, a necessity for distant voyages, translates any spoken language. While holding it, you can understand any spoken language you hear. Moreover, when you communicate by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the speech or see the signing can understand you.

item.name: Un's Codex
entries: This 6-inch wide mechanical disc consists of innumerable layers of technological ephemera. At first blush, it could be a spare starship component, albeit a strange one. However, rotating one of its layers causes other layers to rotate, counter-rotate, or become locked. The disc itself is an intricate puzzle. Solving it unlocks the doors of the universe.

The disc, Un's Codex, is composed of exotic metals of the very same type that can be found on maw stations and within the heart of the Sepulcher Star. Like all other antediluvian relics of such make, its creation is attributed to Old Un, but its true history is lost to time.

entries.name: Solving the Codex
entries: Until the Codex is solved, you don't gain any of its benefits by attuning to it. You can spend 8 hours while attuned to the Codex to solve part of its puzzle, unlocking one of the Codex's properties of your choice. These unlocked properties extend only to you; another creature that attunes to the Codex must unlock its properties to gain their benefits.

entries.name: Blink Step
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} without a spell slot. When you cast this spell using the Codex, you can teleport to a space occupied by a creature, which makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} Force damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and you instead move to the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Extradimensional Lodge
entries: You and up to six willing creatures within 30 feet of you that you choose are transported to a demiplane containing a rustic yet stately lodge. The lodge appears to be within a scenic, coniferous forest, but leaving the lodge teleports you back to the location from which you entered. The lodge has several floors and comfortable accommodations for dozens of individuals. It would seem that previous owners of the Codex have taken up residence here, for nonmagical weapons and equipment are stashed in a few of the rooms. Moreover, the lodge contains numerous hidden compartments and secret passages.

The lodge is attended by dozens of near- transparent servants that obey all who enter. Each servant can perform any task a normal human servant could perform, but they can't attack or take any action that would directly harm another creature. Thus, the servants can fetch things, clean, mend, fold clothes, light fires, serve food, pour wine, and so on. The servants can go anywhere in the lodge but can't leave it.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Slip Gate
entries: The Codex has 4 charges and regains 1 charge daily at dawn. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you create two 10-foot diameter portals at locations you choose on the same plane of existence. These locations must be known to you, or you can specify a general location, such as a particular maw.

The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings filled with mist that blocks sight. They float inches from the ground and are perpendicular to it. Anything that travels through the front of one portal is instantly transported to the other location, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the front of the portal. After 1 minute, the portals dissipate.

entries.name: Universal Function
entries: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action using the Codex to overwrite a fundamental law of the universe in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. You can use this ability to increase or decrease gravity in the area, to change the boiling or melting point of a particular material within the area, to increase or decrease the flow of time in the area (as per the Haste or {@spell Slow|XPHB} spell for all creatures within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}), to make the region breathable (as per Zone of Atmosphere), or to change another fundamental law of your choice, at the GM's discretion. If you attempt to change something that is too fundamental (such as attempting to reverse the flow of time in the area), the Codex does nothing and your action is wasted. This change lasts for 1 minute or until you use this ability again.

entries.name: Destroying the Codex
entries: Though the Codex seems to be fragile, its exotic composition makes it impervious to damage. The artifact can only be destroyed by Old Un itself, but casting it into the Sepulcher Star or any black hole will be sufficient to banish it for {@dice 1d100} years, after which time it will reappear somewhere in the 'Verse.

item.name: Void Beacon
entries: This beacon transmits an ultra-high frequency signal through the Void, allowing it to be detected tens of thousands of light-years away. This signal consists of the beacon's current coordinates and a short message of up to 16 characters (spaces count as characters). This message can manually be changed as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. Once activated, the beacon repeatedly transmits its signal for 7 days and then burns out permanently.

item.name: Weapon Wheel
entries: This device, a bracer with an affixed rotary dial and several buttons lining its circumference, is connected to nine small extradimensional spaces. While wearing this bracer, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to deposit any weapon or object you are holding that weighs no more than 100 pounds and can fit into a 10-foot cube into one of the extradimensional spaces, linking that item to the wheel. The wheel can be linked to up to 9 items at a time, one in each extradimensional space. You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to unlink an item from the wheel.

Once on each of your turns (no action required), you can teleport one of the wheel's linked items to your hand. Doing so also causes any other items linked to the wheel to return their extradimensional spaces.

item.name: Additional Arms
entries: You've installed a secondary pair of arms beneath your normal arms. These arms are fully functional and can be used to hold weapons and shields (allowing you to wield two Two-Handed weapons, or four one-handed weapons), perform Somatic components of spells, and perform other actions, though the arms themselves don't grant you any additional actions or body slots for grafts.

item.name: Android Skin
entries: Once installed, this mechanical skin and musculature makes you indistinguishable from a human. Your other grafts aren't visible while this graft is installed. Each Android Skin is modeled after an existing human, living or dead, and dozens of Android Skins exist.

item.name: Arcane Resonator
entries: With a pure gemstone crystal at its core, the Arcane Resonator installed in your body can synchronize with a magic item, allowing you to attune to up to four magic items at once.

item.name: Arcane Synapses
entries: You have stolen a bit of arcane potential by inserting additional nerves into your brain. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip when you cast it with this graft (choose each time you install this graft).

item.name: Black Box
entries: Once installed, this device preserves your memories, allowing you to recall anything you have seen or heard while it is installed with perfect clarity. This device is incredibly resilient, and will remain intact despite otherwise catastrophic damage to your body. A Black Box's memories can be recovered with a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Technology|DarkMatter24}) check; a failure permanently corrupts the data. The data is also corrupted if it is installed in a new host.
These memories can be reviewed on a Datapad, Arcane Terminal, or similar computer. They can also be uploaded to a new body or a Personality Module using the Transfer Consciousness spell.

item.name: Climbing Apparatus
entries: You have installed a device that allows you to cling to surfaces and move with agility on walls and ceilings. You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.
Your {@variantrule Climbing|XPHB} Apparatus might resemble a set of peripheral limbs, magnetic attractors, or a grapple- hook-launching mechanism.

item.name: Clockwork Wings
entries: Folded into your back when not in use, these silver, mechanical wings grant you a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. You can deploy or retract these wings as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Additionally, you can deploy the wings as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} while you are falling.

item.name: Concentration Module
entries: Your body houses a secondary mechanical mind  to assist in arcane focus. Whenever you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell, you can add your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice when you install this graft), to the roll instead of your Constitution modifier.

item.name: Embedded Armor
entries: Your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can wear armor on top of your Embedded Armor, and you can use either armor to determine your AC. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

item.name: Embedded Battlefist
entries: You replace one of your hands with an imposing, articulated gauntlet, a Battlefist. While this weapon is installed, you are proficient with it and can't be disarmed of it. The Battlefist can hold and manipulate objects, though you can't attack with a Battlefist while holding an object with it.

item.name: Embedded Laser Claws
entries: Emitters in the fingertips can produce a set of razor- sharp Laser Claws. Whenever you would normally be able to draw a weapon, you can transform one or both of your hands into a set of Laser Claws, and you can revert them to their normal forms when you could normally stow a weapon. While this graft is installed, you are proficient with these weapons and can't be disarmed of them. You can't hold or otherwise manipulate a weapon, Shield, or other object with a hand that is transformed.

item.name: Embedded Mini Fridge
entries: This convenient insulated box in your abdomen can store and chill up to six cans of {@item Krash|DarkMatter24}, potions, or similar beverages.

item.name: Embedded Repeater
entries: One of your hands is mechanical and can transform into a Repeater. Whenever you would normally be able to draw a weapon, you can transform your hand into a Repeater, and you can revert it to its normal form when you could normally stow a weapon.

While this graft is installed, you are proficient with this weapon and can't be disarmed of it. You can't hold or otherwise manipulate a weapon, Shield, or other object with a hand that is transformed.

item.name: Embedded Translator
entries: You have a Universal Translator magic item installed within your skull and can use it at will.

item.name: Final Word
entries: Deep within your body, you have installed a miniature Arcane Warhead, whose trigger is linked to your life. When you die, this bomb detonates and destroys your body completely; as a result, you can be restored to life only by means of a True Resurrection or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell. Each creature within a 180-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on your body makes a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. Creatures within a 60-foot radius that have Evasion or a similar feature can't avoid this damage. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 1d4} Mega ({@dice 1d4 √ó 100}) Force damage, or half as much on a successful save.

item.name: Finger Picks
entries: Your mechanical hand has a retractable set of {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB} built directly into the fingers. You can extend or retract these tools as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While retracted, you can conceal them perfectly. You have proficiency with {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB} while the picks are installed. If you already have proficiency, your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} is doubled for any ability check you make that uses them.

item.name: Golem Arms
entries: Your arms have been replaced with the oversized limbs of a golem or a similar Construct. Your reach is 5 feet greater whenever you make an attack with a Melee weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws.

item.name: Hacker Hands
entries: Your newly-installed fingers can plug directly into machines and subdivide into smaller digits for faster typing. While installed, this graft counts as having an {@item Interface Rig|DarkMatter24}.

When you fail an attempt to hack a device, you can use this graft to reroll it, potentially turning failure into success. You must use the new roll, and you can't use this graft to reroll again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Heart of Steel
entries: You have replaced your heart with an automaton's construct core. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

item.name: Heavy Legs
entries: You have installed a mechanical exoskeleton, rooted in your legs. You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to kick a creature of Large size or smaller within 5 feet of you. Make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. On a hit, the target is pushed 5 feet away from you.
You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

item.name: Impulse Unit
entries: You have installed thrusters into your legs and back. Once on each of your turns, when you move at least 15 feet in a straight line, you can move up to 10 additional feet in that direction without spending movement. Alternatively, you can spend 10 feet of movement to jump 10 feet vertically.

item.name: Infrasight Eyes
entries: You have replaced your eyes with sensors that can see in the dark. You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

item.name: Lazarus Unit
entries: You've installed a defibrillator, or a similar piece of technology, into your vital organs. If you are dead or have 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of your turn, the unit jolts you back to life with a surge of electricity. You revive with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. This graft can't revive you if you lack a heart, have died of old age, or are missing vital organs.
Once this graft activates, it can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Logic Unit
entries: Your brain has been augmented with an algorithmic processing unit. You can add half your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (round down), to any Intelligence ability check you make that uses a skill proficiency you lack and doesn't already include your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. Additionally, you know Machine Code, the native code-language of machines. Due to this language, you know the Technomancy cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the feat).

item.name: Overdrive Module
entries: You have installed an internal generator to temporarily accelerate your reaction speed. You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to fire up your Overdrive Module. For the next minute, time appears to move in slow motion. When you activate this graft and as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on subsequent turns, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll or ability check you make before the end of your turn. Additionally, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on a Dexterity saving throw or to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on an attack made against you by a creature you can see.
Once you activate this graft, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Personality Module
entries: A Personality Module contains a neural trace of someone's entire personality: their core memories, manner of speaking, likes and dislikes, and even skills. While this module is installed, you are proficient in two skills, know two languages, and have a personality trait inherent to the personality. Each Personality Module offers a different set of skills, languages, and personality traits, according to whom it was modeled after.

item.name: Remote Eye
entries: You have replaced one of your eyes with a spherical mechanical replacement, which you can remove or insert as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Even while the eye is removed, you can see whatever it sees as long as you are within 120 feet of it. The eye can look in every direction, but it can't move on its own.

item.name: Replacement
entries: One or more of your organs or limbs has been interchanged with an efficient mechanical version. A Replacement can replace an amputated limb or missing organ but can't revive a creature that has died. Replacement limbs can look like the original limb, or can appear metallic or mechanical. A Replacement organ or limb takes up one body slot relevant to it; for example, a robotic hand takes the Arms slot and a replacement kidney takes up the Internal slot. You can have more than one Replacement in a single body slot.

item.name: Shield Module
entries: You can cast the {@spell Shield|XPHB} spell once using this graft without a spell slot. Once you activate this graft, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Shock Absorbers
entries: Shock-absorbing coils in your legs let you bound higher and cushion your landings. The distance of your Long and High Jumps increases by 10 feet (this extra distance costs movement as normal). You suffer no penalty for making a standing High or {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB}.
You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you fall to reduce any damage you take from the fall by an amount equal to five times your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

item.name: Spacewalkers
entries: This graft creates a zone of breathable air, allowing you to breathe underwater or the vacuum of space. The graft also protects you from extreme temperatures and pressures. Additionally, in zero- gravity environments, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

item.name: Arm Blade
entries: Whenever you would normally be able to draw a weapon, you can collapse your mechanical hand into your forearm with a flick of the wrist, extending a wide blade in its place. You can revert your hand to its normal form whenever you could normally stow a weapon. While this graft is installed, you are proficient with this weapon and can't be disarmed of it. You can't hold or otherwise manipulate a weapon, Shield, or other object with a hand that is transformed.

item.name: Arm Cannon
entries: One of your arms is replaced wholesale with a powerful blaster cannon. While this graft is installed, you are proficient with this weapon and can't be disarmed of it. This arm cannon lacks any hand or manipulator, so you can't manipulate a weapon, Shield, or other object with that hand while the cannon is installed.

item.name: Laser Eyes
entries: One or both of your eyes have been replaced with powerful laser emitters, blasters hidden in your pupils. You are proficient with this weapon and can't be disarmed of it. You can't use this weapon if you have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Resistance Plating
entries: This subdermal graft redirects a specific type of elemental energy. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one type of damage while this graft is installed. The GM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.

item.name: Spiked Skin
entries: This mechanical skin conceals thousands of razor sharp spikes, which you can extend at a moment's notice. When a creature you can see within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your
{@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal {@damage 1d4} Piercing damage to that creature. The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach level 5 ({@dice 2d4}), 11 ({@dice 3d4}), and 17 ({@dice 4d4}).

item.name: Thermalsight Eyes
entries: You have augmented your eyes with sensors that detect heat. You gain Thermalsight with a range of 30 feet. (See the Glossary.)

item.name: Titan Armor
entries: You have plating installed into your body, resembling a suit of armor. Your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can wear armor on top of your Titan Armor, and you can use either armor to determine your AC. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

item.name: Traction Spikes
entries: Retractable spikes in your legs allow you to ignore {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Voice Changer
entries: Your vocal cords have been replaced with an electronic modulator, allowing you to change the pitch, tone, and characteristics of your voice at will. You can unerringly mimic any voice or sound you have heard, and you can augment your voice with synthetic effects, such as reverb.

item.name: Bounty Hunter's Vest
entries: The holsters on this vest lead to an extradimensional space capable of perfectly concealing two blasters and a Melee weapon. A weapon stored in the extradimensional space can be drawn at a moment's notice, even outside of your turn, without using a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.

entries.name: Magic Item Set
entries: If you are wearing this vest and carrying a Bounty Hunter's Carbine, you can treat the result of your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls as 10, or your character level plus your Dexterity modifier, whichever is higher.

item.name: Brass Repeater
entries: When you hit a target with this weapon and roll the same number on two or more different damage dice, you can add your Dexterity modifier to the damage roll.

entries.name: Upgraded Magic Item
entries: This weapon grows in power as you do. When you reach character level 5, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This bonus increases by +1 at level 11 (+2) and level 17 (+3).

item.name: Contractor Nail
entries: If you roll a 6 on a {@dice d6} for this weapon's damage roll, you can roll another {@dice d6}, and add it to the damage. When you roll damage with this weapon, you can add a maximum of four d6s to the weapon's damage roll.

entries.name: Magic Item Set
entries: Once on each of your turns, if you hit a target with this weapon and the target has already been hit with an attack using a {@item Contractor Needle|DarkMatter24} this turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage to the target.

item.name: Contractor Needle
entries: If you roll a 4 on a {@dice d4} for this weapon's damage roll, you can roll another {@dice d4}, and add it to the damage. When you roll damage with this weapon, you can add a maximum of four d4s to the weapon's damage roll.

entries.name: Magic Item Set
entries: Once on each of your turns, if you hit a target with this weapon and the target has already been hit with an attack using a {@item Contractor Nail|DarkMatter24} this turn, you can make one additional attack against the target using this weapon.

item.name: Death Ray
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While attuned to it, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast the {@spell Disintegrate|XPHB} spell (DC 17) using it. The blaster can't be used in this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Double Laser Sword
entries: The long hilt of this laser sword projects a second blade from its far end. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic weapon. Instead of {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile}, this weapon has the {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}. Immediately after you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a second melee attack with the weapon.

item.name: Drone Controller
entries: This set of controls, either installed in a glove, integrated onto a Datapad, or linked into a visor, allows you to control a drone. Each controller is linked to a drone, using the {@creature Personal Drone|DarkMatter24} stat block, and is either an Assault drone, a Medical drone, or a Shield drone.

entries.name: Drone Combat
entries: While attuned to the controller, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to issue commands to the drone. Your drone takes its turn immediately before or after your turn each round (your choice). If you issue no commands, the drone doesn't take any actions. Once given an order, the drone continues to follow it until its task is complete.

item.name: Grasshopper
entries: This magic weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d10} Radiant damage on a hit and the target is pushed 10 feet away from you. Once you make an attack with this weapon, it Overheats. An overheated weapon can't be used to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: (Requires Attunement)
entries: This sunstaff was once carried by a heretical avia-ra apologist. When the staff deals the Bludgeoning damage of its Bludgeon mastery property, it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage.

entries.name: Upgraded Magic Item
entries: This weapon grows in power as you do. When you reach character level 5, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This bonus increases by +1 at level 11 (+2) and level 17 (+3).

entries.name: Magic Item Set
entries: Attuning to this sunstaff and an Ankh of Ra and Solar Wings of Ra counts as being attuned to a single item. If you are attuned to the sunstaff and one of these items, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to unleash a blinding beam of light in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. Each creature in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the end of your next turn. The staff can't be used in this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Rebounding Blade
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the {@itemProperty Thrown|XPHB} (range 40/120) property. Immediately after any thrown attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

item.name: Thunder Rifle
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When the weapon hits a target, it produces an explosion in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the target. The weapon can target an unoccupied space within its range. Each creature within {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking half the Thunder damage rolled on a failed save, or no damage on a successful one.

item.name: W-REC
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which is fitted with dozens of absurd and unnecessary modifications. This weapon gains the Automatic mastery property in addition to the Mounted property. If you have proficiency with this weapon, you can use both of its mastery properties, even if you don't have the Weapon Mastery feature, and it doesn't count against the number of weapons you can use.

Once on each of your turns, if you attack with this weapon against a target and hit two or more times, you can make another attack against the same target. This attack is always made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, regardless of circumstance. If this attack hits, you can make another attack against the same target, attacking again if you hit, and so on, until you make a total of five attacks against the target or miss.

item.name: Zipgun
entries: This blaster is designed to be fired only once, but at far above nominal power. On a hit, this weapon deals {@damage 6d6} Necrotic damage. After it is fired, the blaster smolders, ceases to be magical, and becomes unusable.

item.name: Concussion Grenade
entries: This spherical device, dotted with blinking lights, explodes in a wave of concussive force. You can take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to throw this grenade up to 30 feet. At the start of your next turn, the grenade detonates in a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. The grenade has AC 13 and immunity to Poison and Psychic damage; it detonates immediately if it takes damage after it is thrown. Each creature within the area makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} Thunder damage and has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't have the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Chain Reaction
entries: If one or more Concussion Grenades that aren't being worn or carried are within the blast radius of a Concussion Grenade when it detonates, all of the grenades detonate simultaneously in a chain reaction. The Thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the blast radius increases by 5 feet for each grenade, up to a maximum of {@dice 10d6} and a 30-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}.

item.name: Exo-Frame
entries: The enormous frame, which weighs in excess of 2,000 pounds, seems less like a suit of armor and more like a mechanized, bipedal vehicle. You don't need armor training to wear this armor. You can don and doff it as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action by traveling through a series of hatches on the front of the suit. You gain the following benefits while wearing the armor.

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: While wearing this armor, your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 18 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size becomes Large, if it was smaller.

entries.name: Mighty
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Integrated Battlefists
entries: The frame has two integrated {@item Battlefist|DarkMatter24|Battlefists}. While wearing the armor, you have proficiency with these weapons.

entries.name: Life Suit
entries: The frame confers the benefits of a {@item Life Suit|DarkMatter24}.

item.name: Flashbang
entries: As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, you can throw this spherical device up to 30 feet, which detonates in a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} a moment after impact. Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} conditions until the start of your next turn. A creature that shields its eyes and ears automatically succeeds on this saving throw.

item.name: Tachyon Missile Launcher
entries: This shoulder-mounted cannon fires heat-seeking missiles designed to penetrate a ship's hull. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can lock onto a ship or Mega-sized creature you can see within 2,000 feet. The launcher loses its lock on a target if the target moves more than 2,000 feet away from you or takes Evasive Maneuvers. Once locked onto a target, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action on a subsequent turn to fire the missile. Make a ranged spell attack with a +9 bonus. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 3d10} Mega Necrotic damage.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Aimbot)
entries: This elaborate mod contains an integrated Construct that can adjust your aim on the fly. This mod has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} charges daily at dawn. When you make a ranged attack using this blaster, you can expend 1 charge for the Aimbot to attack on your behalf; you forgo rolling the {@dice d20} to get a 10 on the die. If the roll has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, the 10 replaces only one of the two dice, and you roll the other {@dice d20} as normal.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Antimatter Battery)
entries: While this battery is installed, this blaster deals Necrotic damage instead of its normal damage type, and the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage it took. The creature dies if this effect reduces its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum to 0.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Beam Module)
entries: When you make a ranged attack with this blaster, you can activate the Beam Module on the weapon's barrel to focus the shot into a 5-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} that extends out to the weapon's normal range. Each creature in that {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes the weapon's normal damage plus an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. The blaster then Overheats; an overheated weapon can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn. Once you use this mod, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Dragonfire Break)
entries: While this barrel attachment is installed, this blaster deals Fire damage instead of its normal damage type and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage to any target it hits.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Electrocoil)
entries: This barrel-mounted module emits sparks of lighting into the blaster's aperture. While it is installed, this blaster deals Lightning damage instead of its normal damage type and it gains the Jolt mastery property in addition to its normal mastery property. You can only use one mastery property on each attack. You can use the Jolt property of the blaster, even if you don't have the Weapon Mastery feature, and it doesn't count against the number of weapons you can use.

item.name: Blaster Mod (+1 Enchanted Battery)
entries: This arcane battery surges with magical energy. While it is installed, you have a +1 bonus to ranged attack and damage rolls made with this blaster, which is a magic weapon. The bonus is determined by the battery's rarity and doesn't apply to magic weapons that already have a bonus to attack and damage rolls.

item.name: Blaster Mod (+2 Enchanted Battery)
entries: This arcane battery surges with magical energy. While it is installed, you have a +2 bonus to ranged attack and damage rolls made with this blaster, which is a magic weapon. The bonus is determined by the battery's rarity and doesn't apply to magic weapons that already have a bonus to attack and damage rolls.

item.name: Blaster Mod (+3 Enchanted Battery)
entries: This arcane battery surges with magical energy. While it is installed, you have a +3 bonus to ranged attack and damage rolls made with this blaster, which is a magic weapon. The bonus is determined by the battery's rarity and doesn't apply to magic weapons that already have a bonus to attack and damage rolls.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Extended Barrel)
entries: The normal and long ranges of the blaster double.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Magnetic Mount)
entries: The quantum electromagnet installed on the blaster allows you to use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to pull the blaster to your open hand if it is within 60 feet of you and isn't being carried. You can't be disarmed of the blaster unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Overcharge Module)
entries: This external arcane battery overloads your blaster with a surge of energy. When you make a ranged attack with this blaster, you can choose to make an overcharged shot. Doing so causes the blaster to deal an extra {@damage 6d6} damage to the target on a hit. The blaster then Overheats; an overheated weapon can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn. Once you use this mod, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Reinforced Frame)
entries: This composite alloy chassis reinforces the blaster against impacts and enables it to be used as a blunt implement. The weapon gains the Bludgeon mastery property in addition to its normal mastery property, though you can only use one mastery property on each attack. You can use the Bludgeon mastery property of the blaster, even if you don't have the Weapon Mastery feature, and it doesn't count against the number of weapons you can use.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Ricochet Barrel)
entries: Your Ranged weapon attacks using blasters ignore {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} and {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover}, if there exists a solid surface off of which to ricochet the shot towards the target. You can target a creature in {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} with a ricocheted ranged attack using this blaster with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. As normal, if you're guessing the location of a creature in {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} and the creature isn't in the space you targeted, you miss.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Scope)
entries: This high-magnification scope improves the blaster's accuracy, at the cost of close quarters functionality. You don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ranged attacks using this weapon at long range. However, while this mod is installed, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ranged attacks using this weapon out to its normal range.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Silencer)
entries: The hefty suppressor installed on this blaster causes attacks made with it to make only a low pew audible out to 10 feet. The light given off by the blaster is also masked, resulting in a flash at its point of impact, but no visible streak through the air.

item.name: Blaster Mod (Thermal Sights)
entries: This non-magnifying scope grants you Thermalsight (see the Glossary) out to the blaster's normal range while you are making attacks using this blaster. Your Thermalsight provided by this mod is limited to a narrow tunnel. As a result, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks that rely on this Thermalsight.

item.name: Deck of Holding
entries: The deck is a handheld device with a large screen that is connected to an extradimensional space. As a Utilize action, you can touch an object that isn't being worn or carried by another creature to the deck, teleporting it to the extradimensional space. The object must be less than 4 feet across in every dimension and weigh less than 150 pounds. The Deck of Holding can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. Its inventory can be viewed on its screen. As a Utilize action while holding the deck, you can select any item stored within and teleport it to your hands or to an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you.
If the Deck of Holding is destroyed, its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.

Placing the deck in an extradimensional space (such as one created by a {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG}) instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

item.name: Deck of Holding (Expanded Storage)
entries: The deck is a handheld device with a large screen that is connected to an extradimensional space. As a Utilize action, you can touch an object that isn't being worn or carried by another creature to the deck, teleporting it to the extradimensional space. The object must be less than 4 feet across in every dimension and weigh less than 150 pounds. The Deck of Holding can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. Its inventory can be viewed on its screen. As a Utilize action while holding the deck, you can select any item stored within and teleport it to your hands or to an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you.
If the Deck of Holding is destroyed, its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.

Placing the deck in an extradimensional space (such as one created by a {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG}) instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

entries.name: Expanded Storage (Rare)
entries: The Deck of Holding can hold up to 2,000 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 256 cubic feet.

item.name: Deck of Holding (Password Protected)
entries: The deck is a handheld device with a large screen that is connected to an extradimensional space. As a Utilize action, you can touch an object that isn't being worn or carried by another creature to the deck, teleporting it to the extradimensional space. The object must be less than 4 feet across in every dimension and weigh less than 150 pounds. The Deck of Holding can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. Its inventory can be viewed on its screen. As a Utilize action while holding the deck, you can select any item stored within and teleport it to your hands or to an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you.
If the Deck of Holding is destroyed, its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.

Placing the deck in an extradimensional space (such as one created by a {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG}) instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

entries.name: Password Protected Deck (Rare)
entries: The deck is locked with a password associated with its user. Only someone with the password can store or retrieve items from the space. However, a DC 18 Intelligence ({@skill Data|DarkMatter24}) check can hack the device and provide unauthorized access.

item.name: Psionic Piercing
entries: Made of an exotic crystal, a Psionic Piercing resonates with the underlying psionic fields in the 'Verse and enables its wearer to pull against it. These piercings might be rings, studs, bars, or any other form, and can be worn anywhere on the body.

Attuning to multiple Psionic Piercings counts as attuning to a single magic item, up to a maximum of 7 piercings. For each piercing you are attuned to, you gain one psionic energy point, which you can spend to gain the following properties. You can change which properties you have selected daily at dawn.
If a Psionic Piercing property gives you the ability to cast a spell, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (chosen when you choose the property).

entries.name: Empathy (Costs 1 Point)
entries: You can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to probe the mind of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You learn the creature's emotional state.

entries.name: Fly (Costs 5 Points)
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Influence (Costs 2 Points)
entries: You can cast the {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} and {@spell Suggestion|XPHB} spells once each. Once you cast one of these spells with this property, you can't cast that spell with it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Minor Kinesis (Costs 1 Point)
entries: You learn the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip, and the hand is {@condition invisible} when you cast the cantrip with this trait. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell when you cast them with this property (choose when you attune to this item).

entries.name: Prescience (Costs 2 Points)
entries: You can glimpse the future as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The GM reveals something that will likely occur within the next minute. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} that pertain to the event you glimpsed. You can use this property a number of times equal to the number of Psionic Piercings to which you are attuned and regain all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Psiblast (Costs 5 Points)
entries: You emit a burst of psionic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make an Intelligence saving throw. The DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice). On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} psychic damage and has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A creature {@condition Stunned|XPHB} by this effect makes another Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Psychic Resistance (Costs 1 Point)
entries: You have resistance to Psychic damage. {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} (Costs 1 Point). You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

entries.name: Telekinesis (Costs 3 Points)
entries: You can cast {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way daily at dawn.

entries.name: Third Eye (Costs 3 Points)
entries: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 20 feet.

item.name: Gamma Pendant
entries: Like many techno-magical marvels, hardlight magic was uncovered through experimentation and happenstance. However, this was not the first time hardlight had been discovered, as evidenced by the Gamma Pendant.

The pendant is a gleaming mithral medallion, set with fragments of a glowing green crystal. In ages past, the pendant was destroyed and its Gamma Fragments scattered across the 'Verse. Each of these fragments is a magic item in its own right, sought and coveted by an order of Paladins known as Gamma Knights, but the pendant itself is a thing of unparalleled power.

entries.name: Incomplete Pendant
entries: Even while missing fragments, the pendant has the following properties.

entries.name: Flight
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Starborn
entries: You can breathe underwater or in the vacuum of space and you are unaffected by extreme temperatures and pressures (see the Glossary).

entries.name: Lesser Spellcasting
entries: The pendant has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. You can cast any of the Lesser Spells on the Hardlight Spells table from the pendant (save DC 18). The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

entries.name: Completing the Pendant
entries: If three or more Gamma Fragments are unified with the Gamma Pendant, the pendant becomes whole and gains the following additional properties.

entries.name: Gamma Fragments
entries: The pendant gains the benefits of all unified Gamma Fragments.

entries.name: Greater Spellcasting
entries: The pendant's spellcasting improves. It has 20 changes and regains {@dice 1d10 + 10} expended charges daily at dawn. You can cast any of the spells on the Hardlight Spells table from the pendant (save DC 18).

entries.name: Hardlight Edge
entries: Any weapon you wield has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls and can deal Force damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice). If the weapon already has a bonus to attack and damage rolls, use the larger bonus.

entries.name: Spell Absorption
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make against spells. Additionally, in response to a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself casting a spell, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to absorb that spell. The spell dissipates with no effect, the action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} used to cast it is wasted, and the pendant regains a number of charges equal to the absorbed spell's level, up to a maximum of 20 charges. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Destroying the Pendant
entries: The Gamma Pendant is impervious to damage. However, it can be shattered by smashing it between two sufficiently large hardlight constructs: each would need to be roughly the size of a small planet to achieve the desired effect.

entries.name: Body Slots
entries: Each graft takes up one of the following slots: Arms, External, Head, Internal, or Legs. You can't have more than one graft in the same body slot. For instance, if you already have an arm graft, you must remove it before you can attach a different arm graft.

entries.name: First Installation in a Body Slot
entries: The first installation of a graft in a particular body slot is an invasive procedure that often necessitates removing a body part or organ. This installation, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, requires one hour of work, a Healer's Kit and a knife, and someone else to perform the procedure. You lose half of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and all of your Hit Dice when it is completed. Further installations in that body slot have none of these ill effects.

entries.name: Attaching a Graft
entries: After the first installation in a body slot, you can attach a graft in 10 minutes, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}. Whenever you attach a graft for the first time, you can't use  its abilities for 24 hours, as your body adjusts to its presence. A construct graft is permanent until another graft is provided to replace it.

entries.name: Magical Technology
entries: Other gear, such as the {@item Comms Set|DarkMatter24} and {@item Wristwatch|DarkMatter24} are Magical Technology—devices powered by arcane batteries or other sources of magical energy. These devices don't rise to the complexity of magic items, but are still influenced by spells such as {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} and fail in Dead Magic Zones (see the Glossary).

itemMastery.name: Explode
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with an explosion from this weapon's projectile. This explosion is a 5-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point you choose within the weapon's normal range. Each creature within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save, a creature takes the weapon's damage, but don't add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. You can create an explosion only once per turn.

itemMastery.name: Jolt
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon, the creature can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

itemMastery.name: Automatic
entries: When you make an attack with this weapon, you can choose to make two attacks instead. These attacks are always made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, regardless of circumstance. You can't replace these attacks. If this weapon has {@itemProperty AF|XDMG|Ammunition}, these attacks use twice the normal amount of ammunition.

itemMastery.name: Scatter
entries: Being within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your ranged attack rolls with this weapon.

itemMastery.name: Sighted
entries: Attacking at long range with this weapon doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on your attack rolls. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon at long range, you can reroll any of the damage dice and must use the new roll.

itemMastery.name: Bludgeon
entries: You can treat this weapon as a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse}. When you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, it deals Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus the ability modifier used for the attack roll, or {@dice 1d8} if the weapon is used with two hands to make the attack.

itemMastery.name: Mounted
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mount this weapon in a fixed position until the end of your turn. A damage value in parentheses appears with this property. While mounted, the weapon deals that damage when used to make a ranged attack, and the weapon can't be moved.

itemMastery.name: Overheat
entries: If you hit a target with this weapon, you can overcharge the weapon. If you do so, the target takes extra damage of the weapon's type equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The weapon then Overheats. An Overheated weapon can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

itemProperty.name: Destructible
entries: After you make an attack with this weapon, it is destroyed.

entries.name: Recoil
entries: After you make an attack with this weapon, you can't make ranged attacks beyond the weapon's normal range until the end of the current turn.

entries.name: Blaster
entries: A weapon with the Blaster property is a Ranged weapon that requires no ammunition. This property counts as {@itemProperty A|XPHB|Ammunition}.

entries.name: Cooldown
entries: Because this weapon requires cooldown time between uses, you can only fire it once when you use an action, {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you normally make. This property counts as {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}.

entries.name: Firearm
entries: You don't add your ability modifier to the weapon's damage, unless otherwise stated. Firearm ammunition is destroyed upon use.

table.name: Services
rows: 10 CR per day or a cut of profits
Passage Aboard a Ship (Dark Matter Class 1–3)
Passage Aboard a Ship (Dark Matter Class 4–5)

table.name: Trinkets
rows: A handheld glass tube which, when shaken, produces a dim light
The serial number plate from a discontinued model of automaton
A shipping label, stamped many times, implying the package has traveled the 'Verse
A small replica starship. The model depicted only recently became obsolete
A burned-out servo engraved with "3942A 2.5dm Pell Mtech"
The very last page from a Manual of Golems
A ring bearing the insignia of the Galactic Bank
A lead-lined box marked "235." Inside is a small clump of metal that is warm to the touch.
A small jar containing a preserved amoeboid eyespot
A bell enchanted to be silent. In Dead Magic Zones, the enchantment breaks and the bell rings normally.
A dwarven seal which etches a coat of arms onto metal plate
A rolled-up poster of the galaxy's most famous popstar, Elvish Prestley
A wooden mask painted to resemble a vect
A list of dozens of android serial numbers, many of which have been crossed out
A key whose head is shaped like an avia-ra holy symbol. It must fit a bizarre lock.
A carefully folded Star Chart for an unidentified part of space
A Datapad of thoroughly encrypted data and only three access attempts remaining
A metallic leaf from an elven tree-ship
A space marine's helmet, pierced clean through with a blaster bolt
A spacer's small, leather-bound diary. Reading it feels like deja vu.
A steel bat used for the popular sport, siegeball
A piece of amber containing a perfectly- preserved roach
A pair of spectacles which block starlight, revealing an inky, black night sky
A key to a costly and luxurious starship
A glass vial bearing a Nautilid insignia
A silver omnitool, engraved with initials
A necklace adorned with the teeth from various alien beasts
An archaic device that plays a small number of catchy songs through headphones
A golden stole belonging to an avia-ra priest
Playing cards from the glamorous casino, Hotel Horizon, which orbits planet Concordia
An Electrum Piece, marked with an arcane sigil on one side, and a tower on the other
A screwdriver that makes loud noises whenever it's activated
The owner's manual for a commercial starship
A set of three broken power converters, each dusty and filled with sand
A piece of unidentified metal that glows during void jumps
A written contract from the Firm, promising monetary compensation for a job
An instrument like a horn carved from the smallest tooth of an eternal dragon
A gilded finger bone taken from a gold skeleton
A white badge belonging to a crew member of the S.S. Saint Vincent
A novella detailing an assault of alien tripods on a Low World
A jar containing a green fungus that moves and reacts to nearby humanoids
A compass whose needle points to an unknown location far across the stars
An elaborate nonmagical device that creates a mild gravitational field when activated
An unusual map of oceans and continents painted on the back of a ceramic turtle
A detonator from an Arcane Warhead. Its bomb is nowhere to be found.
A timeworn Phaser whose blasts neither stun nor kill; they merely tickle
A commemorative beer stein, reading "Grax's Guy of the Month"
A blank white business card. Looking directly at it causes headaches and nausea.
A potato battery, which looks like it came from a science fair
A patch from a Coalition mercenary's uniform
A set of seven bizarrely shaped dice
A scrambled puzzle cube of six different colors
A vect hand, severed at the wrist
Three keycards: one red, one green, and one yellow, the last of which is splattered with blood
A skath√°ri arrowhead crafted from obsidian that is perpetually warm to the touch
A pinpoint of light suspended in a glass ball
An ancient avia-ra prayer book vandalized in a fervent scrawl
A Holo-Sphere whose recording was corrupted by powerful magic. Through the static, it depicts a faceless Humanoid standing among flames.
A map to a huge Lakshayan weapons cache, lost within the Warzone
The {@item Log Keeper|DarkMatter24} of a long dead pirate captain, apparently marooned by his crew
A small bronze sphere whose constellations point to an eternal dragon's hoard
A black domino mask, like the type worn by costumed vigilantes
An official document from the Hegemony ordering the execution of psions
A bracelet with a blinking light on its face. Evidently, the bracelet is constantly transmitting or receiving data.
The focusing array from a Laser Sword
A school textbook, which seems to be for a xenobiology class
A toy vect with "Will" written on the foot
The skull of an unknown species, hollowed into a mug
A charcoal drawing of a stygian wrothian ship
An experimental blaster mod that appears to be partially melted
A list of spare parts needed to fix a damaged Dark Matter engine
An orcish war flag, riddled with blaster holes
An canister marked "Danger Do Not Open." A wide crack runs along its length.
A recipe book filled with ingredients found on a distant planet
A flute that produces entrancing holographic shapes when played
A device that beeps with increasing frequency as you get nearer to a certain world on the Galactic Frontier
A toy Lakshayan battle frame. If five differently colored toys are found, they can be combined into a larger frame.
A tiny pink umbrella which once accompanied a tropical cocktail on Paradise 1
A spherical, crystal pendant with a small galaxy can be seen swirling within
A solid, copper key with a numbered keychain, stamped with the symbol for a local Hearthstation
A mithral-plated locket displaying the seal of one of the elven houses
A wooden ring carved in the shape of a Var'zuul worm. When not looking at it, the worm slowly crawls around the finger.
A pouch with dozens of coins from different planets
An original model wrenchinator, far smaller than the Wrenchinator 9000
A pair of contact lenses that have constellations dancing across their surfaces
An amulet in the shape of a Maw station
A sealed canister containing a grey sand that might be hazardous nanobots
A parchment map of a planet containing valuable old-world magic items
A book titled "An Idiot's Guide to Laser Swords"
A smooth rock with strange vein-like patterns crisscrossing its surface. "G-seed" is etched into it in elven.
A {@item Log Keeper|DarkMatter24}, filled with the recordings of an enterprising captain on a mission to explore strange new worlds
An elaborate gnomish board game, with dozens of pieces, mock currency, a foldable game board, and a packet of lengthy and confusing instructions
A signed and sealed contract from the Cabal, promising 3% of someone's soul to the Lower Planes upon death
A laser sword the length and shape of a butter knife which toasts bread as you cut it
A Star Chart detailing a perilous, narrow channel through the Dead Magic Zone, terminating at a yellow star with eight planets
A device which, when activated, creates a holographic projection of the maw network

feat.name: Aberrant Spawn
entries: You were somehow mutated or created by an aberration, such as a god-aboleth, and you suffer from strange deformities as a result. Due to these changes, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Aberrant Mind
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition on yourself and against any effect that would read your thoughts.

entries.name: Psychic Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries: At least one of your limbs is muscular, rubbery, and pliant, akin to a tentacle that you can use to make Unarmed Strikes. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes. Additionally, when you use the Grapple or Shove option of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier to determine the save DC. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you deal Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier instead of the strike's normal damage.

feat.name: Android
entries: You are an escaped android—likely a Version 13—that is functionally a perfect replica of a human being, except that wires and blinking lights lie hidden underneath your skin. It is even possible you aren't aware of your construct origins, owing to faulty programming, willing suppression of memory, or intentional tampering with your construct core. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Construct Anatomy
entries: You don't need food, drink, or air. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

entries.name: Machine Code
entries: You know Machine Code, the native code-language of machines. Due to this language, you know the Technomancy cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the feat).

entries.name: Technical Expertise
entries: You gain proficiency in your choice of {@skill Data|DarkMatter24}, {@skill Piloting|DarkMatter24}, or {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24}.

feat.name: Aquanaut
entries: Your world is nearly one continuous ocean, with nary an island in sight. Consequently, you have aquatic features, like gills, webbed fingers and toes, and fishlike scales, that grant you the following benefits.

entries.name: Aquatic
entries: You can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Finned
entries: You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Marine Speech
entries: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB}. It can understand your words, though you have no special ability to understand it in return.

feat.name: Beastman
entries: The 'Verse is rife with wolf-people, horse-people, and other beastfolk, ranging from those with passing bestial features—such as a cat's ears and tail—to those that are indistinguishable from a lycanthrope. You may resemble any type of beast, but always gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Animalistic Reflexes
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity saving throws if you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

entries.name: Claws
entries: You have sharp claws that you can use to make Unarmed Strikes. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal Slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier instead of the strike's normal damage.

feat.name: Green Skin
entries: Your people metabolize by basking in the sunlight, aided by your tough, photosynthetic skin, which grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your skin acts as a tough natural armor. While you aren't wearing armor, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Photosynthetic Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage.

feat.name: Grue
entries: One of your parents was a creature of darkness, such as a shadow or a native to the Plane of Shadow. Grues such as yourself have blackened skin and cast a shadow in all directions, even when directly in light. In shadows, you are nearly {@condition invisible}. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Covert
entries: When you are hidden and a creature discovers you with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to quickly conceal yourself. If your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) roll beats the creature's Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, you silently reposition yourself and the creature doesn't notice you. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@spell Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Swirl of Shadows
entries: When you reach character level 5, you can cloak yourself in perfect darkness. You can cast the {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} spell on yourself without a spell slot while you are entirely within {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. The spell ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or you end your turn in {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Insectoid
entries: Insectoids bear one or two insectlike features, such as prominent compound eyes or chitinous plates, but almost always have a pair of sensitive antennae atop their heads. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blindsight
entries: Due to your antennae, you have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

entries.name: Regenerative
entries: If any part of your body is amputated, but its amputation doesn't kill you, that body part fully regrows over the course of 24 hours.

feat.name: Porterling
entries: You are a porterling, parented both by a human and one of the little folk, either a gnome or a halfling. You stand about as tall as a dwarf, but are far leaner—and if fathered by a gnome, are also somewhat top- heavy. Though they are often confused for dwarves, porterlings can't grow large or thick beards. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Flexible
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks you make to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition or to escape from nonmagical restraints.

entries.name: Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is a size larger than you, but you can't stop in the same space.

entries.name: Springheel Leap
entries: Whenever you make a High or Long jump, you can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. As normal, each foot you jump costs a foot of movement.

feat.name: Proto-Man
entries: You come from a world of ancient fauna and colossal flora. Your people are hardy and robust, much like early humans. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Primal Toughness
entries: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level.

feat.name: Psionic-Awakened
entries: Most humans possess some dull psionic potential, but those that unlock their psionic spark transcend their peers. Sometimes, these humans are indistinguishable from ordinary folks, but other times their psionic awakening leaves a tell-tale mark: stark white hair, glowing pupils, or hair and clothing that float and drift around them. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Empathy
entries: You can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to probe the mind of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You learn the creature's emotional state.

entries.name: Psionics
entries: You learn the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip. You can cast it without Verbal or Somatic components, you can make the spectral hand {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, and its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it.

When you reach character level 3, you learn the {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB} spell, and when you reach character level 5, you learn the {@spell Levitate|XPHB} spell. You always have these spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast the spell in that way again when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast either spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

feat.name: Reptiloid
entries: You bear the abrasive skin, slitted eyes, and forked tongue of a reptile, which grant you the following benefits.

entries.name: Acid Spit
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a lob of acid from your mouth. This is a special ranged attack with a range of 60 feet. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity modifier to its attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d10} {@item Acid|XPHB} damage. This damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach character levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).
You can use this Acid Spit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Reptilian Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid, Fire, or Poison damage (choose when you select this species).

feat.name: Roguean
entries: You hail from an icy, desolate world, thrown away from its home star by some catastrophic event. Surviving the interminable harshness of your home gives you the following benefits.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@spell Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage.

entries.name: Extremophile
entries: You take no damage from cold Extreme Temperatures (see Glossary). Extremely hot conditions affect you normally.

feat.name: Simian
entries: You hail from a world that followed a slightly different evolutionary path to High Terra; your people all resemble monkeys or apes. Despite your furry appearance and prominent tail, you are just as intelligent as other humans—you just like bananas a little more. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Climbing Speed
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: You can hold and manipulate objects and weapons with your hands, feet, and tail, but you can't make attacks with weapons held by your tail.

entries.name: Soft Landing
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you fall to reduce any damage you take from the fall by an amount equal to five times your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

feat.name: Affluent
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heirloom
entries: You gain an Uncommon magic item of the GM's choice, passed down through generations of your family. A {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG} or {@item Cloak of Protection|XDMG} is recommended.

entries.name: Stipend
entries: You gain 100 CR and gain another 100 CR whenever you gain a character level thereafter.

feat.name: Creative
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Innovation
entries: Whenever you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for an ability check, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Double Inspiration
entries: You can have two instances of {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} at one time. You can use only one {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} per roll.

feat.name: Gambler
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Gaming Sets
entries: You gain proficiency with all Gaming Sets and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks you make for games of chance.

entries.name: Losing Streak
entries: Record whenever you roll a 9 or lower on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}. Roll the d20s for {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} sequentially and record them in order. If you roll 9 or lower three or more times consecutively, you can immediately change the {@dice d20} roll to a 20. If this was an attack roll, it doesn't score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. Once you use this feat to change a {@dice d20} roll, discard your recorded rolls.

feat.name: Industrious
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hardworking
entries: Choose one skill with which you have proficiency. When you gain a level, you replace the skill you chose with a different one.

Whenever you fail an ability check using  that skill, you can roll a {@dice d6} and add it to the roll, potentially turning the failure into a success. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Strong Core
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid the {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition.

feat.name: Jinx
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Mutual Misery
entries: When you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes within the next minute.

entries.name: Unlucky Number
entries: Whenever an enemy rolls a 13 on the {@dice d20} for an attack against you or on a saving throw against a spell that you cast, the {@dice d20} roll becomes a 1.

feat.name: Silver-Tongued
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Argumentative
entries: You can use your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma for Persuasion checks.

entries.name: Diplomatic
