entries: When you take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you can treat a {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creature as {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent}, and an {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} creature as {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly}.

entries.name: Polyglot
entries: You learn three languages of your choice.

feat.name: Technical
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cantrip Device
entries: You build a device that allows you to cast cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list that doesn't deal damage (choose when you build this device). When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can build a new device and choose a different cantrip for it, causing the old one to become inactive.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the cantrip you cast with this device (choose the ability when you select the feat).

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: Choose one skill. When you make an ability check using that skill, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of the normal ability score for that skill. When you gain a level, you replace the skill you chose with a different one.

entries.name: Blaster Roulette
entries: If you roll the same number of two damage dice for a blaster, you deal bonus damage equal to that number. You can only add this bonus damage once per turn.

entries.name: Ignore Cooldown
entries: You ignore the Cooldown property of weapons.

entries.name: Run and Gun
entries: When you take the Dash or Disengage action, you can make a ranged attack using a blaster as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Heavy Duelist
entries: You can wield a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed} in one hand.

entries.name: Versatile Dual Wielder
entries: While wielding a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} in one hand, the weapon has the {@spell Light|XPHB} property for you.

feat.name: Chronomancy Initiate
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You learn the {@spell Moment to Think|ValdaSpire24} cantrip.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Spells with the [Chronomancy] tag are added to your spell list.
The spells {@spell Haste|XPHB}, {@spell Slow|XPHB}, and {@spell Time Stop|XPHB} have the [Chronomancy] tag.

entries.name: Prepared Spells
entries: Choose a number of spells with the [Chronomancy] tag equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You always have these spells prepared. Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of these spells with a different spell with the [Chronomancy] tag.

feat.name: Demolitionist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Grenade
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can make one Concussion Grenade, Flashbang, or Freeze Bomb. This item lasts until you finish another {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which point it harmlessly falls apart.

entries.name: Improved Ordinance
entries: Your Bombs, Bottled Lightning, Concussion Grenades, Flashbangs, and Freeze Bombs use the following DC if it is higher: 8 plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Quick Grenade
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Concussion Grenade, Flashbang, or Freeze Bomb.

feat.name: Factotum
entries: You gain the Ability Score Increase benefit and one of the following options of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can replace the chosen option with a different one. You can use the chosen option a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: You can make two Unarmed Strikes as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entries.name: Reckless Attack
entries: When you make your first attack roll on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls using Strength until the start of your next turn, but attack rolls against you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} during that time.

entries.name: Second Wind
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} plus half your character level.

entries.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to one creature you hit with an attack roll if you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll and the attack uses a Finesse or a Ranged weapon. The extra damage's type is the same as the weapon's type. You don't need {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the target, the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, and you don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the attack roll. The extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach character level 7 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), 15 ({@dice 4d6}), and 19 ({@dice 5d6}).

feat.name: Field Commander
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Command
entries: As an action, you can issue a command to an ally within 60 feet that can hear you. It can immediately take an action as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. That action can be used to take only the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Dodge|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, {@action Influence|XPHB}, {@action Search|XPHB}, {@action Study|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. When a creature takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} action in this way, the benefits of that action last until the end of the creature's next turn.

entries.name: Tight Formation
entries: While you are within 5 feet of two or more allies that don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, enemies can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against you.

feat.name: Flex Caster
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Upcast
entries: When you cast a spell, such as {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB}, that can be cast with a higher-level spell slot, you can expend an additional spell slot to increase the spell's effective level by 1.

entries.name: Downcast
entries: When you cast a spell using a higher-level spell slot, you choose to recycle the excess magical energy instead of improving the spell. The spell is cast at its base level and you regain an expended level 1 spell slot.

feat.name: Focused Critical
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

feat.name: Grafter
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Embedded Weapons
entries: You can embed a Simple or Martial weapon directly into your body, or you can embed two weapons (one into each arm) if neither has {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}. Embedded weapons take up the Arms graft slot. When you draw an embedded weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. You can switch which weapons are embedded when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Extra Slots
entries: You have two Arm graft slots and two Internal graft slots. You can install a graft in each of them.

entries.name: Quick Installation
entries: You can take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to install a Construct graft on your body.

entries.name: Painless Attachment
entries: You don't lose {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} from installing or removing grafts, and it takes you no time to recover after the attachment of a new graft.

feat.name: Gun-Mage Adept
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Ranged Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with Ranged Martial weapons.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You learn the Finger Guns cantrip.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The following spells are added to your spell list: Antiballistics Field, Ballistic Smite, Conjure Cannonball, Conjure {@variantrule Cover|XPHB}, Jam Weapon, Jethro's Instant Reload, and Perforating Shot.

entries.name: Spells Prepared
entries: Choose a number of spells equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} from among those in the Expanded Spell List benefit. You always have these spells prepared. Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of these spells with a different spell from the Expanded Spell List.

feat.name: Hacker
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Black Hat
entries: You are always treated as having an {@item Interface Rig|DarkMatter24}. Furthermore, devices never lock after your attempts to hack them.

entries.name: Data Expert
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Data|DarkMatter24} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Quick Hack
entries: You can attempt to hack a device as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, rather than over the course of one minute.

entries.name: Ranged Hack
entries: You can make Hacking attempts on {@variantrule Magical Technology|DarkMatter24} you can see within 60 feet of yourself.

feat.name: Iron Hero
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Underdog's Resolve
entries: When you are attacked by a creature that has a CR higher than your level, you gain a +2 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} for that attack.

entries.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature that has reduced one of your allies to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} since the end of your last turn.

entries.name: Heroic Intervention
entries: When an enemy you can see takes a Legendary Action, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to intercede, preventing the Legendary Action from happening. You can take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Laser Swordsmaster
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cauterizing Critical
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with an {@item Antimatter Dagger|DarkMatter24}, {@item Laser Claws|DarkMatter24}, {@item Laser Sword|DarkMatter24}, or {@item Laser Greatsword|DarkMatter24}, you can rake the target with the blade. Instead of rolling the attack's damage dice twice, you add the attack's maximum damage to the roll.

entries.name: Deflect Blaster
entries: If you're holding an {@item Antimatter Dagger|DarkMatter24}, {@item Laser Claws|DarkMatter24}, {@item Laser Sword|DarkMatter24}, or {@item Laser Greatsword|DarkMatter24}, and another creature hits you with a ranged attack using a blaster, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} for this attack. If this causes the attack to miss, you can deflect the blaster bolt toward a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or take damage as if hit by the triggering attack.

feat.name: Magitechnician
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Magic Item Expert
entries: If one of your magic items calls for a saving throw, it uses the following DC if it is higher: 8 plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

entries.name: Magic Item Recharge
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can recharge a magic item that has charges or properties that recharge at the next dawn. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Marksman's Luck
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Flip Die
entries: Once per turn, when you roll for damage with a Ranged weapon, you can flip one of the damage dice over and use the number on the bottom. You can't use this ability on d4s. Note that for a balanced die, the top and bottom numbers add up to one more than the die's largest number.

entries.name: Enhanced Critical
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with a Ranged weapon, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of its next turn.

feat.name: Mechanic
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Burn Out
entries: You can use the Overheat mastery property on any blaster even if you don't have the Weapon Mastery feature, and it doesn't count against the number of weapons you can use. When you use this property with this feat, the extra damage equals twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and the weapon remains Overheated until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Technology Expert
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Technology|DarkMatter24} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Vent Tape Repairs
entries: You can cast the {@spell Mending|XPHB} cantrip while holding {@item Vent Tape|DarkMatter24}. By expending an entire roll of {@item Vent Tape|DarkMatter24}, you can cast the {@spell Greater Mending|DarkMatter24} spell once without a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. Once you cast {@spell Greater Mending|DarkMatter24} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Merc
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Blaster Melee
entries: When you attack with a blaster, you can replace its mastery property with the Bludgeon property for that attack. You can use the Bludgeon mastery property of the blaster, even if you don't have the Weapon Mastery feature, and it doesn't count against the number of weapons you can use.

entries.name: Point Blank
entries: When you hit a creature within 10 feet of you with a ranged attack roll using a weapon that has the Heavy or Two-Handed properties, the target takes extra damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

entries.name: Tactical Signals
entries: You learn Common Sign Language. You can communicate tactical messages of 10 words or fewer with a creature that can see the message. The creature doesn't need to share a language with you to understand this message, but it must be able to understand at least one language.

feat.name: Precognitive
entries: You feel impressions of events an instant before they happen. When you start your turn, you can roll a {@dice d20} and record the number rolled. You can replace any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made by you or a creature that you can see before the start of your next turn with this roll.
You can use this feat a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Pyromaniac
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Firestarter Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Fire Bolt|XPHB} cantrip and you always have the {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} and {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB} spells prepared. You can cast {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} and {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is the ability increased by this feat.

entries.name: Flare Damage
entries: Whenever you deal Fire damage and roll the highest number on any damage die, you can roll that damage die again and add it to the damage, rolling again if it is the highest number, and so on. You can add a maximum number of dice to the damage roll equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (minimum of 1).

feat.name: Shock Trooper
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: First Strike
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} attack rolls you make with Melee weapons and Unarmed Strikes during the first round of combat.

entries.name: Rapid Advance
entries: On the first round of combat, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is doubled and {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement.

feat.name: Showman
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Expert Performer
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance|XPHB} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Taunt
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mock a creature within 15 feet of you. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes against a creature other than you before the end of its next turn.

You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Smuggler
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Expert Pilot
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Piloting|DarkMatter24} skill. If you already have proficiency in it, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in it.

entries.name: Inconspicuous Cargo
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks you make to hide, move, sell, and lie about cargo.

entries.name: Shoot First
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and don't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, you can draw a blaster and make a ranged attack using it.

feat.name: Shapeshifter
entries: You can use your Biomimicry trait over the course of 1 minute to perfectly alter your appearance.

You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size, and your basic shape stays the same.

feat.name: Night Blessed
entries: You were born aligned with shadows, instead of the sun, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Covert
entries: When you are hidden and a creature discovers you with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to quickly conceal yourself. If your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) roll beats the creature's Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check, you silently reposition yourself and the creature doesn't notice you. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Craven
entries: When an enemy you can see misses you with a Melee attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move 5 feet without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

entries.name: Stealthy
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill.

feat.name: Multiscale
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dual Ancestry
entries: Choose a second Draconic Ancestry option. The color of your scales reflect both of your dragon ancestors. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage type associated with both ancestries, and can use either damage type for your Breath Weapon.

entries.name: Improved Breath Weapon
entries: Your Breath Weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of the type determined by your Draconic Ancestry.

entries.name: Adamantine Skin
entries: While you aren't wearing any armor, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Constitution modifiers. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Adamantine Bones
entries: Any {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against you becomes a normal hit.

feat.name: Ironwood Dryad
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Barkflesh
entries: While you aren't wearing any armor, your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 15. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Natural Regeneration
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can heal your ironwood flesh. Expend one of your {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, roll the die, and regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the roll plus your Constitution modifier. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Technopath
entries: You know the {@spell Technomancy|DarkMatter24} cantrip. When you reach character level 3, you learn the {@spell Technical Difficulties|DarkMatter24} spell, and when you reach character level 5, you learn the {@spell Circuit Breaker|DarkMatter24} spell. You always have these spells prepared. You can cast each of these spells once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast the spell in that way again when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast either spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this feat (choose the ability when you select this feat).

feat.name: Dilettante
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain proficiency in a weapon, skill, or tool of your choice, or you temporarily learn a cantrip from the Cleric, Druid, or Wizard spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's cantrip (choose when you select this feat). You retain this proficiency or cantrip until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Leviathan Suit
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Integrated Weapons
entries: You can integrate a weapon directly into your Aqua Suit, or you can integrate two weapons (one into each arm) if neither has {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. You can switch which weapons are integrated when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Sonar
entries: While wearing your Aqua Suit, you have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet. The range increases to 30 feet if you are underwater.

feat.name: Warzone Nomad
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When you do so, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Exomorph
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Armored Exoskeleton
entries: While you have all of your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you have a +2 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Eat Anything
entries: Any organic matter that you eat provides nourishment. Inorganic matter doesn't provide nourishment, but you can eat anything softer than stone without negative effects.

entries.name: Molt
entries: You can shed your exoskeleton as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, allowing you to remove one or more of the following conditions from yourself: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Prone|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Cyberfiend
entries: Your birth was corrupted by the Foulest Abyss of mechademons, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Cyber Claw
entries: Your fingers bear retractable metal claws. You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes. When you deal damage with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal Necrotic damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier instead of the strike's normal damage.

entries.name: Translocator
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can activate glowing circuits underneath your skin to magically teleport 15 feet to a location you can see.

You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Upgraded
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Configuration Upgrade
entries: When you make an ability check using Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution, you can choose to make it using one of the other two. Alternatively, when you make an ability check using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can choose to make it using one of the other two.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Improved Optics
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to swap your Thermalsight for {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet or {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet. This sense lasts until you use this feature to swap back to Thermalsight or choose a different one.

feat.name: Latent Psionics
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Empathy
entries: You can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to probe the mind of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You learn the creature's emotional state.

entries.name: Improved Psionic Blast
entries: Your Psionic Blast deals an extra {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage.

entries.name: Minor Kinesis
entries: You learn the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip, and the hand is {@condition invisible} when you cast the cantrip with this benefit. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell when you cast them with this property (choose when you attune to this item).

feat.name: Lilliputian
entries: You come from a unique population of halflings, as diminutive to regular halflings as their kin are to humans. You have the following benefits.

entries.name: Tiny
entries: Your size is Tiny.

entries.name: Miniature Weapons
entries: You can only wield weapons designed for creatures of your size. Generally, such weapons are identical to their standard versions but their damage dice decrease by one step ({@dice d12} or {@dice 2d6} ‚Üí {@dice d10} ‚Üí {@dice d8} ‚Üí {@dice d6} ‚Üí {@dice d4}, to a minimum of {@dice d4}).

entries.name: Nimble
entries: {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Fine Wine (Bottle)|XPHB|Fine Wine}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Log Keeper|DarkMatter24}, {@item Perfume|XPHB}, 9 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Born to a family of wealth and prestige, you were given all the advantages of education and connections that your name affords. Your life taught you how to navigate the web of social dynamics that dominates the upper crust of society, and occasionally, how to twist it to your gain. Perhaps you still hold connections to that world, or perhaps you've been ousted from high society, and forced to rely on your wits and whatever worth your name still holds.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB} or {@item Painter's Supplies|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Ink|XPHB}, {@item Ink Pen|XPHB}, {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB} or {@item Painter's Supplies|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Paper|XPHB} (10 sheets), {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (casual), 6 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: You once fell down a rabbit hole of oil painting, electric guitar, theater, or another artform—and never found the bottom. Whether you practiced your art privately or before a roaring crowd, it has become your most fundamental form of expression. Your art has demanded sacrifices in time, resources, and perhaps also in relationships, but you can't possibly imagine doing anything else.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Book|XPHB} (field guide), {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}, 2 {@item Pouch|XPHB|Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (overalls), 17 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: You've always had a fascination with the first green buds that sprout after planting. During your formative years, you might have worked on a farm, cultivated a garden, or raised a plant nursery. Your cumulative experience extends to exotic plants from across the 'Verse, teaching you extensive practical botany. You might have harnessed a bit of magic on your quest to understand the natural world, or you might have relied exclusively on science, pH levels, and chemical compositions of a verdant world.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB} or {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB} or {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Igniter|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 18 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: You were exiled from your homeworld or system and forced to live in a strange land under strange stars. Perhaps you were a political dissident, a troublemaker, or simply ran afoul of the local powers that be. As you've traveled the 'Verse, you've discovered allies and enemies in all corners, wonders and horrors you could never have imagined, but never a place like home.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Binoculars|DarkMatter24}, {@item Flashlight|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (duster), {@item Utility Axe|DarkMatter24}, 18 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: You hail from the Galactic Frontier, the utter edge of the 'Verse where the planets are lawless, the people are tough, and help is usually a thousand lightyears away. On your homeworld, you might have lived off the land, operated a trading post, or practiced an essential trade for the people of your colony. You have almost experienced hardship, either at the hands of others or from the indiscriminate malice of alien beings. Yet you've survived all the same, with stories and tenacity to spare.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Log Keeper|DarkMatter24}, {@item Navigator's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (jumpsuit), {@item Wristwatch|DarkMatter24}, 8 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: As starships jump across the 'Verse, they blip past hundreds of thousands of unexplored worlds, from systems just outside the galactic core to entire swathes of space on the Galactic Frontier. You lived as an explorer, blazing a trail across distant corners of space, searching for worlds or Star Charts that can fetch a few Credits from an interested buyer. On your months-long travels, you've seen spectacular horizons and unfathomable alien vistas, but you have yet to find the Holy Grail of space exploration: an untouched Tier 1 world.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Costume|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Mirror|XPHB}, {@item Perfume|XPHB}, 20 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: You've spent years cultivating an audience in the holo-video sphere, where regular broadcasts of your life and exploits (heightened to a performative extent) have captivated hearts and minds. Among certain crowds, you're an unqualified celebrity; elsewhere, you're basically anonymous. You've searched for greater renown and additional content for the ever- hungry media machine, with the hope of one day breaking into the mainstream and becoming a star.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Ink|XPHB}, {@item Ink Pen|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Log Keeper|DarkMatter24}, {@item Paper|XPHB} (10 sheets), 13 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: In a galaxy with countless cultures and languages, interpreters are indispensable. Even with Universal Translators and other technological aids, the nuances of language require skilled interpreters to translate for any given language. As such, you've spent countless hours immersing yourself in galactic cultures, so as to communicate with as much of the 'Verse as possible.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Book|XPHB} (legal reference), {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, 10 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: You've dedicated years to studying legal definitions and memorizing case law. Perhaps you dealt with high-class criminal trials, or maybe you filed monotonous paperwork and handled divorce proceedings. It's possible you still have a license to practice law on several planets and clientele who rely upon your expertise, or you might have left it all behind in spectacular fashion. Wherever you travel, your legal acumen will likely serve you well.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Backpack|XPHB}, {@item Rope|XPHB}, 10 {@item Silver|PHB} Pieces, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 29 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Low-worlders hail from planets that have yet to discover faster-than-light travel and join the galactic community at large. Perhaps you hail from a world with stone tools and ferocious megafauna, one of castles and dragons, or one humming with electricity and flashing screens.

But now, whether through a teleportation mishap or by hitching a ride on a visiting spacecraft, you've been thrust into the 'Verse. You now find yourself a fish out of water. At all times, you're surrounded by a dizzying array of species, and even the most mundane technology astounds you. The skills you cultivated in your previous life seem irrelevant in this high-tech world, but perhaps you can find a means to ply a trade or find adventure amongst the stars.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}, 2 {@item Hypodermic Needle|DarkMatter24|Hypodermic Needles}, {@item Log Keeper|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (scrubs), 32 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: During your education, you diligently studied xenoanatomy textbooks and learned a dozen different ways to patch up blaster wounds. Perhaps you took a position as a shipboard doctor, a nurse in a megacity trauma center, or as a battlefield medic alongside a mercenary company. You've saved lives by the barest margin and watched others flatline in your arms. One thing is certain: saving others is your life's calling, and plenty of people among the stars need your particular skills.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Bandolier|DarkMatter24}, {@item Igniter|DarkMatter24}, {@item Tactical Vest|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (fatigues), Utility Axe, 15 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: When you were low on Credits or boredom swelled, you learned that you can pick up a blaster and get paid for it. Mercenary work has been your way of life ever since. Most of the time, you stood around in the sweltering heat keeping an eye on things, but very occasionally you got to step into your element: ducking behind cover, exchanging blaster fire, breaking bones, and emerging victorious. Your line of work took you to exotic locales and let you meet exciting people, but it's hardly worth life or limb.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) 2 {@item Flashlight|DarkMatter24|Flashlights}, {@item Rope|XPHB}, {@item Shovel|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (overalls), 25 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Interplanetary mining isn't a job for the faint of heart. You worked long hours, operated antiquated heavy machinery, and dealt with ferocious space creatures. More than one of your former coworkers has been buried underneath tons of rubble when a job went awry. Though you no longer crack open asteroids for a living, you retain every ounce of brawn and persistence that saw you through the work day.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Krash|DarkMatter24} (6 cans), {@item Interface Rig|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (hoodie); 22 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Countless hours in front of an Arcane Terminal has graduated you from clumsy blocks of code to svelte, elegant functions that work your digital will. You might have interned at a tech conglomerate, worked freelance, or took up programming as a pastime. In the structure of coding languages, you've learned how to solve dynamic problems and speak with machines on a fundamental level—building blocks that can help you navigate every level of the 'Verse.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Backpack|XPHB}, {@item Crowbar|XPHB}, {@item Flashlight|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (jumpsuit), {@item Wrenchinator|DarkMatter24}, 4 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: With a ship and a bit of luck, you scavenged derelict ships and crash sites for components and cargo. Each job was perilous in its own way, from ships infested with husks, to pirate attacks, to Dark Matter engines on the verge of implosion. Too often, the best loot is within an utter deathtrap. Salvage work taught you how to spot treasure among trash, how to notice when a ship is too quiet, and how to get out alive.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|XPHB}, 2 {@item Pouch|XPHB|Pouches}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (streetwear), 20 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: From an early age, the streets of megacities or dark allies of Maw stations have taught you that a handful of Credits and a streak of luck is all you need to survive. You've done things you're not proud of—robberies, hovercarjacking, gunrunning—but you've rarely had a choice. Maybe you've fallen in with the Firm or another criminal syndicate, or maybe you preferred working alone, living by your wits and a quick trigger finger to stay above water.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Book|XPHB} (magazine), {@item Holster|DarkMatter24}, {@item Manacles|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (uniform), 20 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Posted at a desk, a door, or a claustrophobic guard station, you've spent the better part of your professional career waiting for something exciting to happen. People in that position long for adventure. When something exciting did happen, it rarely took more than a shoulder tackle or an official-sounding command to pacify a would-be intruder. The long hours keeping watch chiefly taught you how to look professional and remain vigilant, even while watching holo-broadcasts on your Datapad.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Flashlight|DarkMatter24}, {@item Omnitool|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (jumpsuit), {@item Vent Tape|DarkMatter24}, {@item Wristwatch|DarkMatter24}, 28 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Your days were spent hauling heavy cargo across the 'Verse to the tune of timeless Etheradio hits. At the helm of a starship, you've seen the utter edge of the Galactic Frontier, the sprawling hubbub of core worlds, and a few celestial phenomena that bring a tear to the eye. You've become accustomed with the hazards and tribulations of space travel, and always find yourself looking toward the horizon, toward another ship and another world.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Interface Rig|DarkMatter24}, {@item Omnitool|DarkMatter24}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB} (overalls), {@item Vent Tape|DarkMatter24}, 13 CR; or (B) 50 CR

entries: Grease-stained overalls and the smell of solder have been with you since an early age. Machine servos and Construct programming have always come easy to you, perhaps culminating in a job as a ship mechanic or automaton repairperson. Whenever your work station is free of clutter, you fill it again with a new project, an endless conveyor belt of inventions and experimental builds. A huge project probably occupies the periphery of your mind, a white whale that'll require all of your skills and a bit of luck to finish.
